To dream the impossible dream
 To fight the unbeatable foe
 To bear with unbearable sorrow
 To run where the brave dare not go
 
 To right the unrightable wrong
 To try when your arms are too weary
 To reach the unreachable star
 
 This is my quest, to follow that star
 No matter how hopeless, no matter how far
 To be willing to march into Hell for a Heavenly cause.
 
And I know if I'll only be true to this glorious quest
That my heart will lie peaceful and calm when I'm laid to my rest
 
 And the world will be better for this
 That one man, scorned and covered with scars
 Still strove with his last ounce of courage
 To reach the unreachable star

Thank you and God Bless!
Alan

I was having a blah kinda week. You know one of those weeks where you feel like you're running in a hamster wheel🥴. Well my phenomenal staff at our Collins-Westside location decided to love on me today to show their appreciation during a pivotal time for us all, and ya'll they made me cry. 

A good cry though, one of gratitude. 💗
As a leader you don't always get it right, but every great leader surrounds themselves with great people, leads with good intentions, cultivates genuine relationships, and stays humble enough to pivot for the greater good. 

This Collins-Westside team, Ebony N. S. and I opened the 1st Walmart Health in the State of Florida, and Suzette Quaintance took the reigns and carried on our reputation of being the "A" Team, and boy do I love this team. This was just a handfull of them today, as we are winding down our operations across the enterprise. 

As we approach our final month of delivering care to our communities, what I will miss the most at Walmart Health, are the people. These people believed in our mission, they lived it, they executed it, and they did an amazing job! 

If I could sum up my Walmart Health experience in one word, it would simply be "PROUD". 

PROUD of our people
PROUD of our work
PROUD of our imprint
PROUD of our impact
PROUD of the seeds we have planted, that we hope to see grow. 

PROUD, is honestly an understatement, but... it will do for now. 


Grateful, Thankful, and Blessed. 💗

When our daughter Mrinalini was born, we decided to raise her in India during her school years. 

Once when she was six, we were at Delhi airport waiting to board. I noticed her speaking in a whispered voice, concentrating intensely, eyes closed. I asked her later what she'd been up to. She became shy. "Papa, I was sending a message to my school teacher."

"If you cannot write a letter,  there is another way to send a thought over. You send it to God who then sends it across to the person. I wanted her to know that I love her and am looking forward to seeing her again in school soon."

When she was seven, we enrolled her in a summer athletics cubs camp at Columbia. Walking around campus, seeing the statue of Columbia’s beloved mascot, the lion, she announced, “I will go to college here when I grow up.” 

I smiled. “Mrinalini, let time take its course. There are many good colleges, and I am sure one of them is going to be just the right one for you.” Who could say what the future held in store?

She frowned fiercely, as if to tell me, just because I am seven and you’re a bit older does not mean that you don’t take what I know about my destiny seriously.

When she was nine, I noticed her getting very stretched across multiple projects. I thought it was time to sit her down and offer her some adult wisdom. “Mrinalini, as you grow, you’ll see that you can’t do everything, or learn everything, or be everything. You’ll have to make some hard choices.”

“Leonardo de Vinci didn’t have to make hard choices,” she replied.

Never swaying for a moment in her plan for college, 8 years later, she got early admission to Columbia. 

Then last week, Mrinalini Sisodia Wadhwa graduated. As Columbia College’s Salutatorian, she was given the honor of sitting next to the College Dean on stage. She double-majored in history and mathematics & won departmental honors in both fields & a history thesis award. At Columbia, she learned French, Sanskrit and Urdu, was the co-editor-in-chief of the Columbia Undergraduate Law Journal and chair of the Columbia History Association, and co-founded the Columbia Asia Journal. She will now study as a US Rhodes Scholar at University of Oxford. 

At her graduation dinner, I shared her passion for art and poetry. The way she used two corks and three toothpicks to make a giraffe when she was seven, and a poem she wrote on Africa when she was sixteen at a Bostwana safari. I should have also shared her love for knitting, and Odissi, and her daily meditation.

Every child has the seed of something magical in them. All we can do, as parents and caregivers, is to water that seedling and watch it bloom into the radiant flower they were each uniquely meant to be. Because, as India’s poet laureate Tagore wrote, “Every child comes with the message that God is not yet discouraged of man.”

Thrilled to share that I am now cancer-free and on a slow and steady road to recovery. 💜 💪 

A few months ago, a preventative MRI revealed a rare tumor on my pancreas (solid pseudopapillary neoplasm). Thanks to early detection, we acted quickly before it spread, removing just 25% of my pancreas while largely preserving my spleen and other vital organs.  The tests are back, and the cancer is gone.

Key learnings from this journey:

🔹 Proactive Health: Early detection can save lives, and in my case, it did. My cancer was found through a preventative MRI. I had no signs or symptoms of cancer, in fact I was the healthiest I'd been in years.
🔹Self-Advocacy: If you're unsatisfied with your healthcare provider, seek a second opinion at another institution.  Advocate for yourself, even when it feels deeply uncomfortable.
🔹 Empathy: You never know what someone is going through. Be kind and supportive, as they may be putting on a brave face. 
🔹 Gratitude: Immense thanks to Biograph's diligent team for the early detection, my employer and team at OpenAI for their unwavering support, my all star husband Connor O'Brien, and our friends, family, and community for standing by our family through this. Special thanks to the world-class team at Stanford University for their exceptional care through every step of my journey. Truly the best healthcare institution in the world.

Looking forward, I'm increasingly optimistic about the future of healthcare, especially with AI's potential. Numerous promising AI companies in healthcare are emerging, and I'm excited to support their growth through any way possible. I believe that AI will revolutionize healthcare, making early detection and effective treatment more accessible.

Thank you all for your support and encouragement. This experience has strengthened my resolve to live fully and prioritize health, wellness, and family. 💜

General Atlantic colleagues in our New York office gathered to celebrate Pride Month with representatives from The Ali Forney Center, the U.S.’ largest agency dedicated to LGBTQ+ homeless youth. At GA, we are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone feels empowered to bring their authentic selves to work. Our Pride@GA affinity group is a platform for our LGBTQ+ colleagues and allies to connect, share experiences, and foster dialogues on important issues for the LGBTQ+ community. We are proud of our colleagues who champion equality and their work to build a more inclusive future for all.

We recently joined our portfolio company Tripleseat at their seventh annual EventCamp, which gathered over 300 professionals to discuss elevating brand experiences through events. General Atlantic's Jackie Solomon, Global Head of Events spoke about the value of convening our entrepreneurs, limited partners and our global team to drive impact. Thank you to Tirey Thomas for moderating and to Tripleseat for hosting.

column2:
“Professionalism” is often used to sideline LGBTQ people.

“I hear from a lot of trans and gender nonconforming people, dress code is often used as a smokescreen to justify homophobia and transphobia," says artist and public speaker ALOK Vaid-Menon.

“There’s still this idea that our appearance is conflated with our legitimacy...with our ability to do a good job," ALOK says. "We need to disentangle that."

ALOK says that often queer or trans people are penalized or punished for being "visibility emotional, visibly queer, visibly trans in the workplace." They say, don't underestimate that, but also don't underestimate the power of queer and trans leadership in the workplace.

"It begins with an individual saying, 'I’m not going to tolerate this,' and recognizing that creates ramifications and reverberations for all people."

Watch Andrew Seaman's full interview with ALOK: https://lnkd.in/g82Nb9Jq

🎬 Autumn Noel Kelly Elias A. Avalos Mac Pherson

#Pride

Each summer, we welcome Farber Fellows – impact-driven, business-savvy students, who spend 10 weeks working one-on-one with our employment social enterprise partners on capacity building projects.

Eliza Chory-Noyes is an MBA student at the Yale School of Management. This summer, she’ll harness her experiences sourcing and underwriting racial equity funds at Cambridge Associates to support our own REDF Impact Investing Fund! Learn more about Eliza:

➡ Before joining Cambridge Associates, Eliza worked at a humanitarian innovation hub in Kathmandu, Nepal.
➡Eliza helps to lead the school’s Net Impact chapter, and is the co-president of the school’s LGBTQ+ affinity group and a captain of the school’s hockey club. She also sits on the board at the New Haven Pride Center as a nonprofit board fellow.
➡In her free time, she loves hiking and biking with her wife, Maggie.
 
Welcome, Eliza! #MeettheFarbers

I was thrilled to be inducted into the Goldman Sachs Quarter Century Club this week alongside 211 of my colleagues who joined the firm in 1999. Goldman Sachs is an extraordinary place. We should be proud of how long we’ve all worked for the firm and, more importantly, how we’ve positioned it for the future. We’ve been on a long journey together, and it hasn’t been a straight line, but somehow we’ve always managed to keep moving forward, and I’m grateful to have been along for the ride.
 
Congrats once again to the class of 1999.

column2:
Yesterday at the NYSE, we commemorated the 25th Anniversary of Goldman Sachs’ initial public offering. Joined by many of the original IPO team members, we had the honor of celebrating this pivotal moment in our firm’s history by recreating the bell ringing from 1999. 

As part of the celebration, I hosted a dinner with former chairman and CEO Hank Paulson for an audience of IPO alumni, leadership, and others who have been essential to the firm’s success over the years. Hank had an incredible journey – beginning as an investment banker, rising to partner, and ultimately leading the firm’s transition into a publicly traded company in 1999. Under Hank’s guidance, Goldman Sachs navigated the IPO and expanded our global footprint, all while preserving our unique culture and partnership ethos.

Hank put it best: "We would not be Goldman Sachs if we didn't go public because you can't be Goldman Sachs unless you're dealing with the most important clients and markets, and that takes people and capital." Thank you to Hank and all alumni for your vision and the extraordinary standard you set. Commemorating this milestone with you.
column11: Global Head Of Digital Workplace Product Management

Adam Noble is a career technologist, honing his leadership mettle early on with organizations like UPS, Honeywell and Mars. He took is first VP position in the Shared Technology Application and Services office at JPMorganChase, and has since held SVP & CIO positions at GAF, Veritiv Corporation, American Water and now is the now Operating Partner of IT at Littlejohn & Co.

Adam has been a great friend and advocate for the HMG Strategy community for years. Congratulations to you for receiving a 2024 HMG LEGENDS Award at today's 16th Annual New Jersey C-Level Technology Leadership Summit!

column2: After 10+ years with Hershey, I have officially retired today. It’s been a great run. Time to play with the grand kids, play golf, play guitar, travel to far off and close by lands and learn another language, not necessarily in all that order. Sending a general thanks to those whom I’ve met along this journey of life, especially those who lent a helping hand, offered an encouraging word, and those who were kind as well. I’m so grateful for so much, it’s truly humbling to see how much I’ve been blessed. Perhaps our paths with still cross and we can enjoy a fine cocktail, glass of wine or whatever is your choice, as long as we get to spend time, person to person, it’s all good. Peace…

2x Oscar winner Ben Proudfoot x Laura D at Cannes. Ben Proudfoot is debuting two short films at Cannes - L’Oreal and LinkedIn. 

Storytelling has always been the foundation of creativity in advertising. 

Short film is showing the way for short form video which is growing exponentially versus display online. 

As social x entertainment convergence increases it is likely Netflix and Facebook or Instagram will look more like each other.  A platform where people can go to connect, discover, buy and be entertained all in one experience. This is something brands and agencies need to consider thoughtfully. 

What is Ben’s approach to storytelling in short form film and how has this led to two back to back Academy Awards?

What role does short film play in a brand’s messaging and content strategy in the future?

This and more. Join us Monday afternoon.

Proud to be a part of last night's record-breaking crowd at Wrigley Field for the Chicago Red Stars match!
 ️
The energy and passion of the fans were undeniable. Even with rain and chilly temps, we shattered the National Women's Soccer League (NWSL) attendance record – a true testament to the incredible Chicago sports and soccer community!

This wasn't just about the game; it was about seeing young fans cheering for their heroes, experiencing the magic of Wrigley Field for the first time. 
It was about the pre-game energy at Gallagher Way, the shared passion of friends, colleagues, and the entire league.

Huge shoutout to Laura Ricketts and Karen Leetzow for their vision and hustle in making this historic event happen in just under two months! And of course to the incredible National Women's Soccer League (NWSL) with a special shout to Julie Haddon & Jessica Berman. And major props to the Red Stars staff who tirelessly worked behind the scenes to ensure a smooth night.

This is a night women's soccer and women's sports in general won't soon forget. #ChicagoRedStars #NWSL #HistoryMade

A great piece by Meg Linehan on last night: https://lnkd.in/gvVHTwmq

Yesterday, the Chicago Red Stars hosted a Women’s Sports Panel at Wrigley Field on the Business of Women’s Sports and investing in women & the amazing professional athletes across the Pro Sports Landscape.

I am proud to be an investor in the Chicago Red Stars, and see Owner, Laura Ricketts & Team President, Karen Leetzow do amazing and inspiring things to lead this team to great heights.

Here are a few inspiring quotes from yesterday’s panel:

“It’s up to us by purpose  to invest in Women’s Sports and shine a light on what women can do.” Laura Ricketts 

“A big difference I see in terms of investing in women’s sports, is how social media and streaming showed the data that viewership, engagement and interest was there in the women’s game.  This was a big shift and compelled investors and media companies to take a fresh look”.   Ally Wagner (Bay FC Founder & former USWNT Soccer Player).

“We have the platform to bring women’s sports to every HH in the US.  We think Women’s sports is a great business and we want to lead the media industry in championing it…..part of the problem is there is audience for the games but you can’t find enough of the product on air…..we’re going to change”. Brian Lawlor (President Scripps Sports)

So - if you are in the Chicago Area, come watch history as the Chicago Red Stars take on Bay FC.  And if you can’t be at Wrigley, then watch on ION tonight.

Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity Lions is a wrap, and Smartly came to play. Here's a glimpse into our week of sparking industry love and creative revolution, anchored by our campaign of Falling back in love with advertising again:

We kicked off the week with a powerful article from Laura Desmond:
"Reinvention is at the heart of advertising, from the age of media to the rise of AI, our industry has constantly adapted. We dared to transform Cannes in 2005, and the data-driven, programmatic era followed. But consumers are telling us the experience is broken: irrelevant ads, exploding production costs, and a lack of privacy. It's time to fall in love with advertising again. We need to bring creative, media, and intelligence together to create meaningful experiences that power brand love and performance. Brands that tightly connect creative with media, think full-funnel, and leverage AI will win." 

Our First Smartly Branded Cannes HQ: We brought the Smartly vibe with a stunning Croisette view from our penthouse rooftop, hosting industry legends across holdco’s platforms, brands and sports & fueling passionate conversations about the power of technology to power creativity. #FallInLoveWithAdvertisingAgain

Tech + Creativity = ❤️: We championed the power of creative technology to reignite brand love and unlock growth. Smartly is the bridge between the fragmented landscape and a future of storytelling that's both creative & impactful.

Global Thought Leaders: From global creative leaders Rob Reilly, Alexandre Abrantes, Jo Shoesmith, Claudine Cheever, Chaka Sobhani, to storytellers like Double Oscar Winner Ben Proudfoot, we hosted insightful talks that challenged the status quo and ignited a passion for innovation.

The Business of Women’s Sports Take Center Stage: We spotlighted the booming business of women's sports with two powerful panels including Thayer Lavielle, Heather Hopkins Freeland, Flaujae Johnson, Angela Ruggiero, Jessica Berman, Meg Linehan. Smartly sits at the heart of the social & streaming channels driving this growth. #InvestInHer

Leaving Cannes, we're energized to lead the charge towards a future where intelligent creative fuels brand love and growth. The best is yet to come! #SmartlyatCannes2024 #CannesLions2024

P.S. Big thanks to Cheerful Twentyfirst 21 for bringing our vision to life!
column23: Jordan Richards thank you. The Smartly Team rocked it. We are so thankful for so many smart, bright and thoughtful leaders in advertising, brands, and women’s sports investing their time with Smartly this week.

column2:
The business of women's sports is booming 🔥 brands, marketers and investors are stepping up. Had an incredible 360 discussion from the lens of athlete, investment, brand and talent management about women's sports as the next big play 🏆 Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity

"The next generation isn't going to be thinking "men's sports/ women's sports - they're thinking sports" Heather Hopkins Freeland, Adobe

"By 2050, I think women's sports will eclipse men's sports. The market doesn't meet the value right now. There is pent up demand, and the market needs to adjust. Sports is a great investment, but women and athlete-led in particular, is going to continue to push the industry" Angela Ruggiero Sports Innovation Lab

"Business is business, but when you have good people, business can be personal. And that builds security and trust with the athlete. When I choose a deal, it's about deciding if a brand really cares. " Flaujae Johnson

Laura Desmond Lina Polimeni
column23: Proud of these women - they are impatient, they want change and they believe women’s sports is a business to bet on. Shout out to you - Thank you all -

column2:
Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity day 3. Early morning session with social tech leader Smartly with one of my mentors in the industry Laura Desmond.  Women’s sports is the next big play.  “Growth and business behind women’s sports is worthy of more supply,  more audiences and fandom.”

We are at an inflection point. Hey brands what gets funded gets attention.  This is a smart business play that both Eli Lilly and Company and Adobe have noticed. 

Incredible panel. As a Canadian I can only hope we replicate some of this momentum up north. 

Flaujae Johnson Angela Ruggiero Heather Hopkins Freeland Lina Polimeni Thayer Lavielle 

#canneslions2024
column23: Thank you for being there. Love you Alex!

column2:
I credit Laura Desmond for single-handedly turning me into a sports fan — which is saying something, considering I retired from sports after being arguably the worst player on my 5th grade Seattle Chinese Athletic Association basketball league...

Inspiring conversation at the Smartly Penthouse about the role of Brands on the Women's sports rocketship:
"Brands aren't just doing it to check a box or to be popular. It's to build business. If you can show that it can be a thriving profitable growing business, then you just through some barriers that are incredibly important for society. Brands and partners who get that are special."

#SmartlyCannes24 #WorkSmartly #SupportWomensSports

2x Oscar winner Ben Proudfoot x Laura D at Cannes. Ben Proudfoot is debuting two short films at Cannes - L’Oreal and LinkedIn. 

Storytelling has always been the foundation of creativity in advertising. 

Short film is showing the way for short form video which is growing exponentially versus display online. 

As social x entertainment convergence increases it is likely Netflix and Facebook or Instagram will look more like each other.  A platform where people can go to connect, discover, buy and be entertained all in one experience. This is something brands and agencies need to consider thoughtfully. 

What is Ben’s approach to storytelling in short form film and how has this led to two back to back Academy Awards?

What role does short film play in a brand’s messaging and content strategy in the future?

This and more. Join us Monday afternoon.

As I prepare to close this chapter of my career, I reflect with gratitude on the amazing experiences and opportunities I've had at McDonald's. It's been an incredible journey, filled with wonderful people across all three legs of the stool. 
To my colleagues, mentors, O/O and the entire McFamily, I extend my heartfelt thanks for your support, collaboration, and friendship. Being part of this remarkable brand has truly been an honor, and I am excited to continue cheering on McDonald's from the sidelines.

Sprite Limelight is back..

Led by an exceptional line-up of fearless, international artists – Puerto Rico’s Young Miko, Nigeria’s Fireboy DML, Brazil’s XAMÃ, China’s Lay Zhang, America’s Doechii, South Africa’s Blxckie and Britain’s Mahalia – Sprite Limelight offers fans original new tracks, music videos and emotive, relatable storytelling, designed to deliver that much needed cool-down for when the tension rises.

Each artist used their respective artistic visions and musical styles to creativley interpret a core hook crafted by GRAMMY-nominated DJ/producer/songwriting due, Take A Daytrip - sampling, singing and altering the lyrics and melody to manifest a suite of original tracks. The finished products showcase Afrobeat rhythms alongside soulful R&B and raw rap artistry.

Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity Lions is a wrap, and Smartly came to play. Here's a glimpse into our week of sparking industry love and creative revolution, anchored by our campaign of Falling back in love with advertising again:

We kicked off the week with a powerful article from Laura Desmond:
"Reinvention is at the heart of advertising, from the age of media to the rise of AI, our industry has constantly adapted. We dared to transform Cannes in 2005, and the data-driven, programmatic era followed. But consumers are telling us the experience is broken: irrelevant ads, exploding production costs, and a lack of privacy. It's time to fall in love with advertising again. We need to bring creative, media, and intelligence together to create meaningful experiences that power brand love and performance. Brands that tightly connect creative with media, think full-funnel, and leverage AI will win." 

Our First Smartly Branded Cannes HQ: We brought the Smartly vibe with a stunning Croisette view from our penthouse rooftop, hosting industry legends across holdco’s platforms, brands and sports & fueling passionate conversations about the power of technology to power creativity. #FallInLoveWithAdvertisingAgain

Tech + Creativity = ❤️: We championed the power of creative technology to reignite brand love and unlock growth. Smartly is the bridge between the fragmented landscape and a future of storytelling that's both creative & impactful.

Global Thought Leaders: From global creative leaders Rob Reilly, Alexandre Abrantes, Jo Shoesmith, Claudine Cheever, Chaka Sobhani, to storytellers like Double Oscar Winner Ben Proudfoot, we hosted insightful talks that challenged the status quo and ignited a passion for innovation.

The Business of Women’s Sports Take Center Stage: We spotlighted the booming business of women's sports with two powerful panels including Thayer Lavielle, Heather Hopkins Freeland, Flaujae Johnson, Angela Ruggiero, Jessica Berman, Meg Linehan. Smartly sits at the heart of the social & streaming channels driving this growth. #InvestInHer

Leaving Cannes, we're energized to lead the charge towards a future where intelligent creative fuels brand love and growth. The best is yet to come! #SmartlyatCannes2024 #CannesLions2024

P.S. Big thanks to Cheerful Twentyfirst 21 for bringing our vision to life!
column23: Jordan Richards thank you. The Smartly Team rocked it. We are so thankful for so many smart, bright and thoughtful leaders in advertising, brands, and women’s sports investing their time with Smartly this week.

Women’s Sports Merch is BIG BUSINESS!

Utilizing a balanced analysis of both first party transactional data and custom survey data, we estimate that the women’s sports merchandise market to be valued at $4Billion. This number takes into account the current rate of women’s sports fans buying merch, fans seeking merch, average spend on merch, and those who said they would buy more if it was available.

Brought to life by the smarter flexible payments network Klarna and Sports Innovation Lab, “Rep Her: Revealing the Unmet Demand Demand for Women’s Sports Merchandise,” is the latest research report from The Fan Project, and is available for download. #RepHer

Shop women's sports merchandise: https://hubs.la/Q02DrHkK0

Download the full "Rep Her" report NOW: https://hubs.la/Q02DrvLM0

There's a common assumption that there isn't an audience for women's sports apparel.

But that "is absolutely not true," said Klarna's Megan Gokey. And it's costing the companies that make and sell merch — as well as teams and leagues — as much as $4 billion a year, according to a new data analysis by Klarna and the Sports Innovation Lab released Wednesday.

In addition to calculating the value of the largely untapped market, a study from the Sports Innovation Lab found 60% of women’s sports fans have wanted to buy merchandise but couldn’t because of a lack of inventory.

“There's a big market here and, like everything else in women's sports, it has been underserved, misunderstood and there's things we can do to fix it very easily,” Angela Ruggiero, the Hall of Fame ice hockey player who is co-founder of Sports Innovation Lab, told USA TODAY Sports.

Read more from Nancy Armour:

People used to look at my background and openly say, “Hmmm, you didn’t go to the right school”.
 
I would go into rooms and I look different…I’d say things that are different…and I didn’t really fit in with the rest of the group…
 
Perhaps I have gotten used to it, because it’s 𝐟𝐢𝐧𝐞 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐦𝐞.
 
But that takes a level of confidence that I have to bring with me every time I walk into the room…a confidence I got from those who #invested in me.
 
I wouldn’t be where I am in my #career without the people who believed in me…who were willing to accept me…
 
And willing to see my potential.
 
A profession like ours shouldn’t be limited to people who look the same…sound the same…and come from the same background. 
 
It’s quite simply bad #business.
 
We need Wall Street to start removing their own limits…and take a look at people they wouldn’t have considered in the past.
#Educationaldiversity

This month, we're placing the spotlight on Kelley Megale, our Strategic/Enterprise Account Executive, Wealth Management. She discusses the "why" behind her highly collaborative and cross-functional approach to partnering with prospective clients, touches on why she was drawn to Canoe, and explains how she finds inspiration through her family, travel, and giving back.

"We truly have amazing people who work at Canoe, and I try to showcase that to the prospect. They are not just signing up for incredible tech but will be working with a partner to help grow their alternative business in the future," said Megale.

"When a prospect or client shares new functionality they are looking for, that is something our Product team is constantly working on. Having previously worked at larger corporations, seeing how quickly we can turn around an idea or feature has been exciting and refreshing."

Read Kelley's full spotlight: https://hubs.li/Q02DcxCW0

PODCAST 🎙️: Building wealth is an unequal pursuit. Scott Galloway believes no one is getting more screwed financially than young people.

Scott argues what the U.S. is doing to the economic future of its youth is nothing less than a war on the young. The massive transfer of wealth from young to old is a topic he explores in his new book "The Algebra of Wealth".

I was delighted to have Prof G back on A Bit of Optimism to share what’s been on his mind lately and enjoyed veering far off-topic to discuss love, money, and the nature of true friendship.

🎧 Listen to our full conversation wherever you get your podcasts: https://lnkd.in/etKrMuFi

The 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris are gonna be insane, and I'm gonna be joining the NBC team to cover all the excitement! 

You know I had to get in on this action. 
As a longtime Olympics fan, I've been watching the games ever since I was a little kid. 

Seeing top athletes pour their heart into chasing their dreams? 
That's the real thrill, ya dig? 

This summer, I'll be reporting live from Paris, giving you all the inside details on the must-see events.
We're talking record-breaking performances, amazing comeback stories, and sports drama that'll have you on the edge of your seat. 

Expect my signature honesty, plenty of laughs, and a vibe that'll make you feel like you're right there with me, soaking up the Olympic spirit.
2024 Olympics and Snoop Dogg, lets get it….

Stop by booth #518 to talk about how our lab testing and regulatory consulting services can help support your food safety and quality programs!

#foodtesting #foodsafety

Our Melville, N.Y., testing laboratory has added U.S. FDA registration to test over-the-counter (#OTC) drug products! 

Capabilities now also include #cosmetic and #supplement testing.

Additional services will initially focus on microbiology, with analytical chemistry to be added in the coming months:

> Microbiology (USP <51>, <61>, <62>); pathogens
> Preservative Efficacy Testing (PET)
> ISO 17025-accredited
> cGMP/cGLP-compliant

Our team, including Elaha Karimi, Richard Boehler, and Robert Scott, are now processing samples.

Message Michael Silvia if you need testing.

We have announced Vodafone Group’s preliminary results for the 2024 financial year:

- Group organic service revenue increased by +6.3%, and we are now delivering growth in all of our markets across Europe and Africa.
- Vodafone Germany, our largest business, returned to growth
- We saw continued acceleration in B2B revenue throughout the year, with Vodafone Business FY24 service revenue +5.0%.
- Adjusted EBITDAaL increased by 2.2% like-for-like.
- Strategic successes over the year included:
▶️ Customers: €140m invested in improving customer experience. Now lead, or co-lead, net promoter scores in 5 out of 9 European markets. 
▶️ Simplicity: New organisational structure and management team in place. 
▶️ Growth: Re-shaped Vodafone’s European footprint with sales agreed of businesses in Spain and Italy, and a merger between Vodafone UK and Three UK to increase competition and deliver better 5G networks for UK customers. 

Our CEO, Margherita Della Valle said: “A year ago, I set out my plans to transform Vodafone, including the need to right-size Europe for growth. Since then, we have announced a series of transactions and we are now delivering growth in all of our markets across Europe and Africa. Much more still needs to be done in the year ahead. We will step-up investment in our customer experience, improve our underlying performance in Germany and accelerate our momentum in Business, whilst also continuing to simplify our operations throughout the group. We are fundamentally transforming Vodafone for growth.”

You can read the full results news release here: https://lnkd.in/dw_n3P9H

Certified Group is pleased to announce David L. Morgan II as Chief Executive Officer. Mr. Morgan succeeds Amanda Bosse, who remains with the Company as an Advisor. 

Certified Group companies (Certified Laboratories, Inc., EAS Consulting Group, LLC, Food Safety Net Services, and Labstat International Inc.) provide mission-critical and time-sensitive testing and regulatory consulting services to the food & beverage, dietary supplement & NHP, cosmetic, OTC, personal care, tobacco/nicotine, cannabis, hemp, and other regulated end markets.

“It’s an exciting time to join the company, and I strongly believe in the significant growth opportunities ahead. I look forward to continuing the company’s mission to consistently provide quality lab testing services and a best-in-class platform, and I believe the company is well positioned to grow,” said Morgan.

In addition to Mr. Morgan’s appointment, Deborah Kerr will join Certified Group as Executive Chair. 

Ms. Kerr is a Managing Director and Co-Head of Value Creation at Warburg Pincus, a majority investor in Certified Group. 

“After working closely with Certified over the past 5 years, I strongly believe in the unique market position the company has in providing differentiated lab testing services. I look forward to working closely with David; his experience leading healthcare and diagnostics companies will bring a strong, experienced perspective to the strategic direction of the company,” said Kerr.

Read the full press release here: https://hubs.ly/Q02ygZsM0

🎉This Saturday I celebrated the completion of my 3 year Modern Apprenticeship program with AES Indiana's community relations team. It has been truly rewarding to learn and grow both personally and professionally as early as my junior year of high school from the mentorship of motivated, hard-working community leaders as well as being a part of the moving forces powering a positive impact in the Indianapolis community. 

I am super grateful with the EmployIndy and Ascend team as well as with Marion County Public Schools for connecting me to this amazing opportunity and offering me a speaking role in Saturday's Farewell/Signing Day Ceremony. It is always great to continue learning new things and to challenge myself to step out of my comfort zone. I am excited to see what's ahead in my academic and career endeavors since I know this is just the beginning of a great journey ahead!

👏 Standing ovation for the first 100% renewable energy company in Colombia! 

In their recently published sustainability report, AES Colombia outlined plans to triple its installed renewable capacity by 2030, reaching 3000 MW. The great team led by the visionary Federico Echavarria is working on an impressive pipeline of solar, wind and energy storage projects that will triple our renewable portfolio in Colombia. 

With a goal of carbon neutrality by 2025, AES Colombia is a true leader in sustainability. This ambitious goal will become possible thanks to the dedication and professionalism of the team, who is constantly expanding the boundaries of innovation, offering the cleaner and greener energy solutions our customers need. 

At The AES Corporation, we are proud to be strategic allies in Colombia's energy transition, enabling our customers in the country achieving the decarbonization of their energy matrix. In 2023 our solar parks in Colombia generated nearly 150,000 MWh of renewable energy and contributed to the reduction of 54,000 tons of carbon dioxide.

On Thursday, I had the pleasure of attending the Goldman Sachs Capital Markets conference in New York City. There, Stephen Dubner, co-author of Freakonomics, explained that, in a world where uncertainty and complexity prevail, it is crucial to approach predictions with humility. As Daniel Kahneman wrote in his book Thinking, Fast and Slow, "A plan for the future is an act of faith that cannot be based on certainty." Recognizing the limitations of our own knowledge and understanding can prevent us from falling victim to overconfidence and bias, allowing for more accurate and nuanced predictions. By maintaining a humble attitude towards our predictive abilities and leading with curiosity, we open ourselves up to learning from mistakes and adjusting our strategies accordingly. Ultimately, humility in prediction-making is not a sign of weakness, but rather a strength that leads to more thoughtful and insightful decision-making. 

What is your process or approach when making predictions?

Carbon Capture is much simpler and economical from solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) due to the nature of the technology. As the name alludes to, the electrolyte only lets oxygen ions go through and blocks everything else in the air. This leads to a highly pure stream of CO2 on the anode side of the cell making both energy and the capex required to separate CO2 significantly lower. As CTO of Bloom Energy it's been a pleasure developing our carbon capture solution for our SOFC based energy server.

My co-founder Nate Weger and I are joining the Activate Fellowship 2024!!

For three years, I’ve been looking up the amazing Activate Fellows and Staff members who are creating and supporting groundbreaking, science-based companies that tackle the world’s biggest challenges, including, the climate crisis. 

Since 2015, Activate has supported 147 companies (such as Sublime Systems, Twelve, and Fervo Energy) and catalyzed $2.3B funding for these companies. 

It is wild to call myself #ActivateFellow today. Thank you for the recognition and trust in what we are building at Calectra. 

The Calectra team has already felt the Activate effect. It has been incredible to be surrounded by kind-hearted, hard-working, and smart people who are using their skills and time to build impactful solutions for tackling the climate crisis and other global challenges. The entrepreneurial education has started. Activate has also opened its extensive network.

My first experience with the devastating effects of climate change was the Cedar Rapids Flood of 2008. Almost 10% of the people in my hometown were displaced from their homes, and this flood caused 7x more damage because of climate change. 

Since then, it’s been my goal to contribute to the fight against climate change. Today, we have the chance to reduce suffering on a global scale, by acting now to minimize our greenhouse gas emissions.

This mission has taken me through the University of Iowa and University of California, Berkeley, where I gained the knowledge and skills necessary to begin tackling this immense challenge. During my PhD at Berkeley, my team at Berkeley Lab and I identified heavy industry as one of the most difficult sources of emissions to tackle, with huge potential for positive impact. 

During the next several years, we explored what it would take to decarbonize industrial process heat, which makes up 1/4 of all energy used in the world and accounts for 10% of global carbon emissions. We designed a thermal storage material and system that could provide this industrial heat at prices competitive with fossil fuels, and proved many of the critical features of this technology on a lab scale!

Our results were so promising that I decided to begin looking into what it would take to commercialize this, and bring the technology into the real world. This brought me to the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE)'s Cradle to Commerce program, where I met Pauliina Meskanen.

Very quickly after meeting Pauliina, I knew this was somebody I wanted to work with. She has the determination, motivation, skills, and personality required to build a successful company from the ground up, and we decided to start working together almost exactly a year ago.

From these initial conversations, Calectra was born! Pauliina and I founded Calectra together with the mission to electrify and decarbonize industrial process heat. Since last May, we’ve found that high-temperature industry (steel, cement, glass, chemicals, aluminum) is especially lacking in solutions for decarbonization. We are full steam ahead on filling this gap!

We’ve got big plans, please follow along as we work to build Calectra and change the world!

Standing on the shoulders of giants, I am humbled to lead Stanford's Precourt Institute for Energy into the next chapter. The Institute's mission (and that of Stanford Doerr School of Sustainability) is to "glue" the many people and organizations working on energy across Stanford and beyond. 

Following the vision of Jay Precourt and the footsteps of Lynn Orr, Arun Majumdar, Sally Benson and Yi Cui, I am excited to continue this mission of building connective tissues that will contribute to the energy transition. In particular, I am thrilled for my partnership with Ira Ehrenpreis, Mike Morgan and the entire Precourt Advisory Council. 

My journey with Precourt began nearly 20 years ago. My PhD thesis with Sossina Haile was part of Stanford's Global Climate & Energy Project, a predecessor to today's Precourt Institute. In 2010, I was hired as the first faculty member of the Institute, joint with Stanford University School of Engineering's Materials Science & Engineering department. 

Looking forward, I am excited to work with Stanford Energy's amazing people to make a difference.

Yesterday, at the age of 105, Virginia “Ginger” Hislop graduated from Stanford University Graduate School of Education with her master’s degree. When she started on campus in 1936, her plan was to get her bachelor’s of education, which she did in 1940, and obtain her master’s of education so she could teach, which she started directly after. 

However, just after completing her coursework and before turning in her final thesis, her then-boyfriend George Hislop, ’41, a GSE student in Reserve Officers' Training Corps (ROTC), got called in to serve during World War II, prompting the pair to get married and Virginia Hislop to leave campus before graduating. 

Now – 83 years after leaving campus and living in service to learning – Virginia Hislop returned to Stanford to finish what she started and receive her graduate degree. When she rose from her seat at the ceremony, donned in cap and gown, to walk across the stage and receive her master’s hood, the applause roared. She was handed her diploma and smiled for the cameras. Her grandkids waved and cheered. 

“My goodness,” she said. “I’ve waited a long time for this.”

🗞️: https://lnkd.in/g_zMm3kb
📸: Charles Russo

Corrosion of alloys in high temperature molten salts is often considered from the point of view of the alloy. A relatively less studied aspect, however, is the influence of the corrosion on the "fouling" of the molten salts themselves. In his recent publication (https://lnkd.in/eNnkyyv2), Kondaiah Paruchuri explores this subject in detail for molten nitrate, carbonate and chloride salts and shows that the corrosion resistant coatings developed at the Advanced Materials and Technologies Laboratory (https://amtl.me.vt.edu) not just mitigate corrosion of the alloys at high temperature but also reduce fouling, thereby preserving the properties of the molten salts better for thermal energy capture and storage. 

See his other works at https://lnkd.in/eQB3iZy7

Yesterday, I had the honor of hosting my first graduation ceremony for one of my new programs called "Stepping Stones." This program is specifically designed to support women who have experienced trauma to help them heal and move forward in their lives. Trauma can have a profound impact on a person's life, and it is essential to confront and address it in order to overcome its effects.

I am incredibly proud to share that twelve courageous women successfully completed the program and shared their powerful stories during the graduation ceremony. It was truly inspiring to witness their strength and resilience.

I was also privileged to have my dear friend, Retired Federal Judge Vanessa D. Gilmore, as our guest speaker. Her speech was nothing short of amazing, filled with valuable lessons and words of encouragement. Her presence added an extra layer of significance to the event.

Reflecting on this journey, I am overwhelmed with gratitude. It is truly humbling to witness the positive impact our program has had on the lives of these women, and I am grateful to be a part of their healing process.

column2: I could not be more proud of, and grateful for, my CNP and extended utility industry family as we work around the clock to restore the 900,000+ customers affected by the tornadoes and severe storms that hit Houston Thursday evening. We have restored more than 550,000 in the first 48 hours and we will not stop until every last customer is back on.

Had the incredible opportunity to sit on the panel at the WEN Executive Breakfast during the WEN Conference in Atlanta last month. 🌟

I shared my thoughts on how culture is the essence of how we operate and interact within our environment. Leadership can set the vision and direction, but it's our teams that truly drive the culture forward. Cultural growth and change emerge from the collective actions, attitudes, and behaviors of individuals across all levels of the organization.

As leaders, our role is to create an environment that empowers and inspires our teams to embody the desired culture and conditions for success. By fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and inclusivity, we can create a thriving workplace where employees feel valued, engaged, and motivated.
Thank you to everyone who attended and contributed to such a meaningful discussion!

#WENConference #Leadership #CorporateCulture #Collaboration #Innovation #Inclusivity #Teamwork #Reworld #ReworldWaste #ReimagineYourWorld #SustainableWasteSolutions #CircularEconomy #EnvironmentalJustice #Sustainability #ESG #CircularEconomy #ZeroWaste #CSuiteBestie #TequilaSmith #BlackWomenLeaders

Georgia, we DID it! 
 
Thirty-two years ago, I was an engineer here at Plant Vogtle, designing valves, piping systems and running turbine vibration testing. It has been a moving and inspirational experience this week to be back on this site, commemorating Units 3 & 4 — and celebrating Plant Vogtle as the largest generator of clean energy in the U.S. Georgia did what no one else has been able to do in decades – bring two newly constructed nuclear reactors into operation to serve customers. 
 
It was AWESOME to come together with so many leaders from across the state – including our co-owners, Governor Brian Kemp, members of the Georgia Public Service Commission and other elected officials – to celebrate this historic achievement. On behalf of the thousands of employees and craft labor who have worked on this project, we are so thankful to our partners who were steadfast, loyal and strong — partners who worked together with us through challenges and successes along the way. It wasn’t easy, but we stayed focused on safety and quality to get the job done to benefit our customers and the state of Georgia for generations to come.

Taking a moment to recognize and thank our Overhead Tranmission teams who are working and truly powering lives on Father’s Day weekend. Happy Father’s Day to them and thank you for your dedication and commitment.

Mother Nature never takes a break- even on Father's Day weekend.
 
Thursday night near Bloomington, a storm took down more than 30 transmission structures, leaving roads blocked and customers without power. Our crews went to work immediately, safely grounding downed lines to begin repairs and power restoration.
 
Watch as Blaze Weber, a dad & overhead electrician, talks us through the job at hand. We thank Blaze and all of our employees for a continued job well done and wish them all a happy Father's Day!

Celebrate Father's Day with us as we honor the dads of the Secret Service. These dedicated fathers balance protecting our Nation and cherishing their families - they do it all.

Happy Father’s Day to all the amazing dads in our agency! 

#FathersDay #HappyFathersDay #DadLife #CelebrateDads #Fatherhood

⛈️ Strong storms ripped through parts of central Illinois Thursday, damaging over 30 transmission lattice structures just outside of Bloomington. Our dedicated lineworkers are working to safely make repairs and restore power in the area. 

As the summer storm season progresses in our area, these weather events emphasize our need to continue strategic investments that modernize our grid to withstand severe weather caused by climate change year-round.

Happy #PrideMonth to all of our employees and customers in #OurCommunities who are celebrating this June! This month is a time to be kind, celebrate inclusion and create spaces where people are welcome to be themselves. 
❤️🧡💛💚💙💜

A new BSEE grad from Iowa State, June 11, 1990 marked the beginning of my career at ComEd, starting as a field engineer. 

Then I blinked!!!!!  😃😳😃😳😃

34 years later, 1/3 of my department is younger than any of my daughters and 2/3 were born after I started here. Don’t blink!

- Old Man Johnny P&C

Join us in celebrating our 2024 Chicago Defender Man of Excellence, Nwabueze Phil-Ebosie! 🎉
 
For Eze, our director of engineering, #STEM excellence runs in the family. "I come from a family of STEM professionals and saw how hard they worked to be in their respective fields and make an impact. At an early age, I was shown the value of hard work and dedication," he said. "Because of these role models in my life, I have been inspired to have an impact in my own way, and I am extremely passionate about the development of the next generation of Black engineers.”
 
#CDMOE24

I’m super energized from our preview expo event today! 🎉 Our interns got to experience the excitement firsthand during their first week, which set an incredible tone for their journey with us. It was truly inspiring to hear Colette Honorable speak to our brightest and youngest minds, sharing her invaluable insights and experiences. We couldn’t have asked for a better kick-off to the program. Looking forward to tomorrow’s sessions and all the amazing interactions ahead!

I am incredibly honored and thrilled to share that I have been featured in this month's issue of *Woman Engineer Magazine*! 🎉

Being recognized among such a talented group of women in engineering is both humbling and inspiring. This feature highlights my journey, the challenges I've overcome, and the passion I have for pushing boundaries in our field.

A big thank you to *Woman Engineer Magazine* for this opportunity and to all my mentors, colleagues, and friends who have supported me along the way. This recognition is a testament to the collective effort and encouragement from my amazing network. Carolyn B. John Schoen

I’m happy to share that I will be on a panel with some extraordinary utility leaders at the Energetic Women conference this summer. In this panel discussion we will share our journey, challenges, and successes. Sure to resonate with leaders at all stages, I encourage anyone in the natural gas and electric industry to check it out and consider registering at www.energeticwomen.org.

We're incredibly honored to welcome Mark Baranek Senior Vice President of Technical Services at ComEd, to the Meals on Wheels Chicago Board of Directors!
 
Mark's dedication to our mission goes far beyond his impressive title. For years, he's been a true supporter to Meals on Wheels Chicago. From coordinating employee volunteers to cheering us on at galas and golf outings, Mark's passion for supporting our mission shines through.
 
Recently, Mark organized a company volunteer effort where he stood in as a "sous chef," helping teach seniors how to make healthy recipes. This hands-on involvement highlights his dedication to our cause, going above and beyond to not only organize the event but also directly contribute to its success.
 
But it's Mark's own words that truly capture his heart: "I am excited to join the board and bring my leadership skills to further the mission of Meals on Wheels Chicago. This organization holds a special place in my heart, and I look forward to making a positive impact."
 
Mark, we are thrilled to welcome you to the Meals on Wheels Chicago family! Together, with your leadership and the continued support of our community, we can ensure nutritious meals and independence for Chicago's homebound seniors and people with disabilities.
I’m happy to share that I’m starting a new position as Principal Energy Consultant at Dandelion Energy!
I’m happy to share that I’m starting a new position as Department Manager of the Manhattan Electric Control Center at Con Edison!
What an amazing experience!  It’s fantastic to see how NYC is turning our garbage into useful energy and reducing GHGs in the process. Hope there’s more to come!

Twenty- three years ago, I walked into a room, joined a cohort, and expected a few years would pass before I moved on to something else. Along the way, I have had the opportunity to interact with thousands of our customers, start and complete transformative projects and programs, cheered on colleagues as they achieved their version of success, learned from brilliant leaders, and most importantly, made friendships that have made all the difference in my life. There have been epic highs and devastating losses, but I wouldn't trade a moment of it. 

Thanks to all of my colleagues for making it such a wonderful place to work.

Some great sessions at the Northeast Energy Efficiency Partnerships (NEEP) conference this week in Weehawken, NJ sponsored by Con Edison. Lots of exciting synergies in policy, federal, state, and utility funding for clean energy and equitable decarbonization. Now, the work begins!  Wish I could have caught every session. Lots of good discussions on streamlining access to incentives and initiatives to improve and standardize rebate and energy efficiency project data.

Great teams working on great things!

Con Edison AKF Group Adam Shelly Charlie Marino Brittni Provencher, PMP

I’m happy to share that I’m starting a new position as Senior Manager, Energy Efficiency and Beneficial Electrification at Baltimore Gas and Electric!

I'm thrilled to be joining the BGE Clean Energy Solutions team while so very thankful for my time at Pepco Holdings.

I am pleased to report that I will become Co-Chair of the New York City Bar Association (@New York City Bar Association) Energy on September 1st of this year. Robie Craig of New York City will be my co-chair. Justin Gundlach and Elizabeth Stein have done a great job running this committee and I am also pleased to be succeeding them. 
Please message me if you are interested in joining the committee. We have important tasks to tackle as our State seeks to implement its Climate law, the Climate Leadership and Community Protection Act.

LinkedIn family,

It's been a while, so thank you for allowing me a moment to share some updates via a very long post. I’m eager to reconnect and hear from you as well.

Reflecting on my 25-year journey in cybersecurity, I'm grateful for the people, experiences, and milestones that have enriched my professional life. From shaping go-to-market strategies for emerging cybersecurity companies to achieving a number of strategic exits, each experience has been a blessing.

As an immigrant displaced by the Russian invasion of Afghanistan, the boundless opportunities in America profoundly influenced my work ethic and values. The legacy of dedication and resilience instilled by my father, who served with the US Department of Defense, and my mother's bravery which helped us escape a war torn country, continues to inspire my commitment to the cybersecurity and defense sectors.

A career highlight was my tenure at Proofpoint, where we as a team grew the company from $20 million to $1.4 billion in annual recurring revenue over 13.5 years, from early-stage to IPO, and later acquisition by Thoma Bravo. I'm thankful for the friendships forged and lessons learned.

Along the way, I developed an obsession with the US venture capital ecosystem and how it consistently generates the world's most significant companies. Starting with pre-IPO investments in Facebook and Palantir I went on to invest in and help over 100 innovative startups over the last 15 years. This path eventually led me to launch my own VC fund called Inflection Ventures in December of 2022.

At Inflection Ventures, we focus on private companies in cybersecurity, defense, and technology infrastructure, primarily looking for growth stage companies (at their point of inflection) but also supporting and advising friends in the ecosystem across all stages.

These photos are from a visit with Shield AI in Dallas, where I met with cofounder and CEO Ryan Tseng. Shield AI leads in developing AI systems for defense applications, enhancing autonomous decision-making in critical missions where GPS and communications are compromised. Their mission aligns perfectly with our goals, and represents the impactful work we support.

Please message me if you want to catch up or learn more. I'd love to hear your voice. 

I appreciate all of you and am extremely grateful to all the LPs on this journey with us!

All the best, 
Kabe


#CyberSecurity #Defense #VentureCapital #Investment #AI #Startups #TechInfrastructure #Entrepreneurship #Databricks #Anduril #Abnormalsecurity #Proofpoint #SpaceX #Cyera #Oasiscyber #Crowdstrike #PaloAltoNetworks #ShieldAI

After working hard for over 40 years, I have decided to step out of active work for a little while, clear my head and decide on the direction for the rest of my life. Consequently, as of June 1st, I have left RWE Many thanks to Markus Krebber, Ulrich Rust, Andrew Flanagan, Alison Gardner and the rest of the people at RWE Clean Energy that I have had the opportunity to get to know in the past year. Thanks also to Con Edison for the amazing opportunity to achieve so many of my professional goals. I am eternally grateful. 

Now on to the next stage. I haven’t decided what that will be yet, except for going back to school for a masters in history and otherwise doing what I really want to do. I’m open to help – your suggestions, advice and offers are welcome. And the reverse is true, I’m happy to be of assistance in any way I can.

The best journeys are the ones we take #together. Future’s bright!

Yesterday at the Women’s Conference, I was honored to receive the SHEro award for Equity. This award is given to someone who has worked to promote and advance equity in the workplace. To be nominated and recognized by some of my peers for this has been an incredibly humbling (and surreal!) experience.

The women’s conference has been the most inspiring 2 days, and I take home with me so many kernels of wisdom for my professional and personal life. I am so honored to work alongside such thoughtful individuals, who aside from their day to day work, take on more to make the workplace and employees better. 

I think Maria Pia Tamburri said it best on day 1 of the women’s conference, when after her interview at Dominion Energy, she went home and told her husband that Dominion had good people. I echo this thought: Dominion has good people to work with and great people to know. I’m so fortunate to call so many of my colleagues my friends.

Lastly, a special shout out to my DEV Operations Support team who rallied for the occasion! I’ve never felt so celebrated by my peers and my leadership. I’ve received such an outpouring of support throughout the process. There is truly no better team out there!

What a moment! I still cant believe that I was honored by the Governor of South Carolina Henry McMaster with the 'Excellence in Scientific Awareness' award. I am incredibly thankful to the SC Academy of Science (especially to President April Heyward, MRA), and words can never express my gratitude. 

I wanted to use this opportunity to express few things:
- 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐞𝐧𝐯𝐢𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐨𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡, 𝐢𝐬 𝐜𝐫𝐮𝐜𝐢𝐚𝐥 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐬𝐮𝐜𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐬. If where you are is not working for you, move. Life is too short, and we're not structures, we are living beings and my move to USC made my career happen.
- 𝐒𝐨𝐮𝐭𝐡 𝐂𝐚𝐫𝐨𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐚 𝐢𝐬 𝐚𝐧 𝐚𝐰𝐞𝐬𝐨𝐦𝐞 𝐩𝐥𝐚𝐜𝐞. I'm so fortunate to have moved here. What a lucky move!

And ... 
- After 10 wonderful years at the University of South Carolina, I am moving to Clemson University. A dedicated announcement on that will be coming soon, but I wanted to take this chance to share my message:

𝐆𝐚𝐦𝐞𝐜𝐨𝐜𝐤𝐬 𝐚𝐠𝐚𝐢𝐧𝐬𝐭 𝐓𝐢𝐠𝐞𝐫𝐬 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐨𝐭𝐛𝐚𝐥𝐥 𝐟𝐢𝐞𝐥𝐝, 𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐲𝐰𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐞 𝐞𝐥𝐬𝐞 𝐓𝐢𝐠𝐞𝐫𝐬 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐆𝐚𝐦𝐞𝐜𝐨𝐜𝐤𝐬 𝐭𝐨 𝐩𝐮𝐬𝐡 𝐒𝐂 𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐝.

Listen to my full acceptance speech below, used an AI tool to create the subtitles, so cool :)
I’m excited to share that I have been promoted to Senior Business Performance Analyst at Dominion Energy! Thank you to my mentors and colleagues at Dominion Energy for their unwavering support.

Our teammates at Ladysmith, Roanoke Rapids and Gaston power stations are doing incredible work. It was great to visit the stations and see everyone’s enthusiasm as they talked about our investments in reliability and the environment. We are upgrading our combustion turbines at Ladysmith to increase megawatt output and flexibility. We have also upgraded the control systems at Roanoke Rapids and Gaston, and we have completed projects that protect the passage of eels and fish. I love that our team is committed to our mission – and constantly generating new ideas to improve our operations!

The CEO and Power of U…!

These were the key themes of Dominion Energy’s Women’s Conference. It was an inspiring celebration of the power of community to support one another in our lives and careers. It featured phenomenal speakers such as Hannah Craft Sower and Angela D. Reddix, Ph.D.

I was fortunate to be a part of this awesome event and have the opportunity to speak to ideas that are deeply important to me: the power of your words and the value of your voice.

Thank you and congratulations to everyone who contributed to making this incredible conference such a success!

Great things happen when you put together 30,000 books, 3,000 kindergartners, a book fair and a summer reading program…

Our volunteers from Cope and Wateree power stations in South Carolina helped kindergartners in Colleton and Bamberg counties select 10 grade-level reading books to take home. The Original Six Foundation, a nonprofit that focuses on literacy in rural and underserved areas of the state, received a grant from Dominion Energy to help fund its My First Library program and these end-of-the-year book fairs.

Wednesday marked a monumental splash as we installed the first of 176 monopile foundations as part of our Coastal Virginia Offshore Wind project. These steel, vertical cylinders measure over 272 feet long and tip the scales at nearly 1,500 tons each! 

Anchored into the sea floor 29 miles off the Virginia Beach coast, this foundation is set to support a tower and turbine nearly as tall as the Statue of Liberty and Washington Monument combined. 

Now that’s a strong foundation for a cleaner energy future! 

Read more: https://lnkd.in/erXCEpzy

📷: RPS

It’s hard to believe that it has been over 25 years since I began my corporate career in the energy and utilities industry as the first African American officer at Duke Energy. My time at Duke Energy as its Vice President of Energy Policy and Strategy was tremendously rewarding and provided me an excellent foundation for advocating for a diverse portfolio of generation solutions as we combat climate change. Thank you Duke Energy for recognizing me in your “Illuminations: Celebrating Black Achievements”. I am proud to be a Duke Energy alum.

I am honored and grateful to have received the Originality SHEro Award at the 2024 Dominion Energy Women's Conference. This award symbolizes a woman's courage to think outside the box and blaze a trail forward. I hope to continue embracing forward-thinking ideas. Thank you to all the inspiring women leaders in the company who have paved the way for the next generation such as Wendy Wellener and Diane Leopold. 


#girlpower #Dominionenergy #2024womensconference #empowering

The 2024 Dominion Energy Women’s Conference is complete and what a great time was had by all!  Together we explored how to build our own board of directors, advocate for ourselves, power ourselves and our careers.  And recognized our second annual SHEro award recipients!  We have many rock stars on our Dominion Energy team.  Thank you to Robert Blue Diane Leopold Carlos M. Brown for being part of the program and for enabling and sponsoring a culture of inclusion. Utibe Bassey Loved co sponsoring this amazing event with you! 

Dominion Energy celebrates women in many ways - we belong here - our girl power is infectious - this was a meaningful and powerful way to show that commitment! Dominion Energy 

#Girlsruntheworld
#girlpower

We’re thrilled to welcome Valor Environmental to the Markel Group. We look forward to supporting them as they continue to grow by helping their customers keep dirt and water where it needs to be – something they’ve done so well since 2003.

Full press release: https://lnkd.in/dt3ASVW6.

When I moved back to my hometown in 2016, I found an RVA that had transformed and grown in so many positive ways. 

Upon my return, one of the first events I attended was a talk by Sports Backers' Executive Director, Jon Lugbill, about the organization’s progress and impact on the community—and I was blown away. 

Jon also shared his vision for Sportsbackers. 

He spoke eloquently about the James River – and what an asset it is for our community. 

While the accessible, clean river is a key part of the canvas that makes RVA so livable, and in the words of Jon, our “awesome active, outdoor river town,” the people of Sportsbackers help paint it to life. 

Every year, Dominion Energy RiverRock fills the James River and surrounding canal area with leaping dogs, kayaks, concerts, and more than 100,000 smiling faces. 

Each spring, SportsBackers transforms Monument Ave, filling it with runners and its median with meditators, live bands, cheering crowds, and so much more—for what I believe is the country’s fourth-largest 10K. 

They partner with companies like Markel for the #CorporateRun. 
And they fill the holiday season with the CarMax TackyLight Run and whimsy. And more: https://lnkd.in/gXVjXbgS

This spring, it was a pleasure to partner with Megan Schultz and Will Dixon from Sportsbackers—both dedicated RVA “painters”—to make the inaugural Markel Group Reunion Walk & Run happen. 

Megan and Will are quintessential “yes, and…” people with incredible energy and positivity. 

Thank you, Megan, Will, and Sportsbackers, for your amazing contributions to our city.

I was honored to accept the special Work/Life Flexibility award at last week’s Richmond Times Dispatch Top Workplaces ceremony. I am also very proud that we placed third in the mega employer category. Being recognized as one of the Top Workplaces for the second year is a wonderful achievement, especially as it’s based entirely on our employees feedback.

Please take a couple of minutes to listen and share this message about forgiveness, grace, and gratitude.

column2: Honored to wrap up Edison Electric Institute's 2024 annual conference in Las Vegas with the legendary Olympian, Michael Phelps. Of particular interest to me was our discussion on the importance of focus, goal setting and discipline to achieve your objectives. It was great to learn that Michael drives an electric vehicle and has installed solar and battery storage at his home and how interested his children have been about the process. Together, we all need to champion a cleaner, more sustainable future for generations to come. #EEI2024 #energyfuture #sustainability

I am honored to begin my tenure as Chair of the Edison Electric Institute and am deeply grateful for the opportunity to serve our industry in this capacity. I want to extend my heartfelt thanks to Pedro Pizarro for his exceptional leadership over the past year. 

As we look to the future, I am excited about the opportunities ahead for the electric utility industry. Together, we will continue to innovate, collaborate, and drive forward initiatives that ensure a reliable, affordable, and clean energy future for all.

EEI has accomplished much, and we have a lot to do in the year ahead.

column2:
SEND ME YOUR CUTS!

I recently heard someone on a podcast about our industry say that the next generation of aspiring trailer editors needed only to hear from the young editors now working in the trailer companies because they really couldn’t relate to the editors who were cutting trailers in the 80’s.
This actually made me smile.
I am one of those editors who has been editing trailers since the early eighties and I am still cutting these days. I am also a company owner always looking for another gifted, motivated and passionate young editor dying to do what I have been blessed to do for over 40 years and join the amazing folks at Rebel.
A couple years ago, I noticed a cut that someone posted here on LinkedIn and it blew me away.
I contacted the person who had done it. He was a junior in college!
Nick Chapman interned for us the next eighteen months and I am proud to say, right after graduating is now one of our amazing editors at Rebel and kicking ass!
Recently I have been receiving amazing cuts from young editors from around the world and they were unbelieavable!
I am happy to say that next month, two high school students will be interning with us at Rebel, one coming all the way from Denmark!
So, the moral of the story is…connect with the people who actually have been doing what you aspire to do, no matter how long they have been doing it and keep showing them your cuts.
They can recognize talent and they are most likely the ones who will be able to provide the opportunity for you to join our amazing industry.
Keep cutting, explore, try crazy ideas, have fun!
Send me your cuts! I will give you feedback and help you hone your skills.

column2:
Exciting news for #SoutheastTexas 👀

To support the region's rapidly growing energy needs, Entergy Texas submitted a proposal to build two state-of-the-art natural gas power plants in Liberty and Jefferson counties. The Legend and Lone Star Power Stations will provide enough safe, reliable, and sustainable energy to power nearly 300,000 homes while bringing $2.8 billion in economic benefits to the #SETX community. More importantly—these projects are projected to save customers ~$370 million over the lifespan of each plant. 📈

The proposal for 24/7 dispatchable generation is part of our Southeast Texas Energy Plan (aka #STEPahead). The plan aims to add 40% more generation capacity to the #SETX power grid by 2028. Click the link to read what state officials and industry leaders have to say about our #STEPahead plan and our proposal to build the Legend and Lone Star Power Stations. ⭐️ 

📰: https://lnkd.in/gMi4M9gY

#EntergyTexas #WePowerLife #txenergy #txlege
column11: SVP, Chief Technology & Business Services Officer

column2:
Today Entergy Texas submitted its proposal to build Legend and Lone Star Power Stations - two natural gas power plants in Jefferson and Liberty counties. These 24/7 dispatchable resources will address the critical need for increased power generation capacity, support increased economic activity throughout the region, and pave the way for sustainable energy solutions that will benefit #SETX for decades to come.

These future-forward projects are projected to save customers approximately $370 million over the lifespan of the plants. These power stations are expected to be in service in 2028 and will bring a total of $2.8 billion in economic benefits to the region. Approval of the two facilities by the Public Utility Commission of Texas will increase service reliability for all customers and support large-scale economic activity in the region like Sempra Infrastructure’s Port Arthur LNG facility. The design of these plants will also enable carbon capture and hydrogen co-firing technology.

Today's filing is a critical step forward for our recently announced Southeast Texas Energy Plan, also known as #STEPahead. The strategic plan aims to add additional generation capacity to the power grid by 2028, critical transmission to get power where it’s needed, and grid-hardening projects to help Southeast Texas withstand extreme weather.

column2: Whew, that feeling when something you’ve been working hard on finally makes its debut! 🙌 🎉 Us marketers know bringing a new product to market is never easy and there are countless hours that go into every aspect of turning an idea on paper into a tangible offering in real life – from the work involved to build the product but also to figuring out how to “tell” and “sell” it. There was a lot that went into the “how” behind this achievement and it was truly a quest – but what a reward to see it out there in the world! And it couldn’t have happened without the smart, passionate, dedicated and hard-working folks I get to work with every day at GeoBlue as well as our colleagues at MetLife and our agency partners who supported us in this endeavor. I’m especially proud of my team who I can always count on to put their heart and soul into the work to make sure we deliver – for each other, the company, and our clients and members! 💓 🙏 👏

column2:
On this podcast, I had the privilege of comparing notes with Samer Zawaydeh, Sean Penrith, and our host, Laurie Beth Nix. In New England we have set ambitious goals for achieving carbon neutrality, and both electrification and #energyefficiency solutions will be key drivers of these efforts. Samir and Sean brought an international perspective.
 
Listen to our full discussion on the Association of Energy Engineers website to learn more about why there is a need for a multi-faceted approach to decarbonization and electrification, as the industry works toward a clean energy future. https://bit.ly/3L3VqxF

Notice the Viking in the cross walk light? I'm in Denmark this week as part of a U.S. delegation to compare notes on industrial decarbonization and clean energy. Huge thanks to The American Council for an Energy-Efficient Economy (ACEEE), the Consulate General and Innovation Centre Denmark Silicon Valley, and the Climate Imperative Foundation for making this happen.

First stop: Aarhus. Two days in, what stands out the most is that ANY waste is anathema. Think energy efficiency, first, second and third. There is no ideological or political debate about this – just accepted common sense.

And yes, Denmark is also a very beautiful country where bikes rule.

#decarbonization #cleanenergy #energyefficiency

Did you happen to notice a minor adjustment to the setting on your Wi-Fi thermostat last week? It’s what we call “Demand Response” in the wonky and technical energy community. On hot humid days like we’ve been having, demand on the electric grid is significant. For those signed up for our ConnectedSolutions demand response program, small adjustments are made to the thermostat for a couple of hours to reduce demand on the grid. 

Last week Amy Findlay, P.E. and her team were hard at work overseeing this choreography. The chart below shows what happened on Thursday, when along with utilities across New England, we were able to drop the peak by 300 MW during the three-hour peak energy event timeframe – equivalent to powering approximately 200,000 homes. Amy and her team are already delivering on the vision for Virtual Power Plants. 

#VirtualPowerPlants #VPPs #Decarbonization #DemandResponse

Kimberly Cullinane, C.E.M. and I had the pleasure of visiting the Boardwalk Campus in the Acton-Boxborough Regional School District (ABRSD) – an all-electric, geothermal school that is on the road to becoming net zero. Thank you to our partners, Kate Crosby and Peter Light for having us, and for making this project a reality through their vision and leadership.

The Eversource Energy and ABRSD project team designed and built this school through the Mass Save Path 1: Net Zero and Low EUI Buildings program, with an Energy Use Intensity (EUI) goal of 23.1 – which is well below the Massachusetts school median score of 65. The Boardwalk Campus building surpassed that EUI target and has been operating for over a year at less than a third of the energy use per square foot of a typical Massachusetts school. It is a remarkable achievement, and this building can now serve as a statewide and national model for decarbonization and high-performance energy efficiency.

To learn more about the Boardwalk Campus and our partnership with ABRSD, please read our press release. https://bit.ly/4exSk2H

🌍 Climate Action: A Business Opportunity? Join the Discussion! 🌍 

The U.S. Consulate General Chennai, in collaboration with IIT Madras Research Park (IITMRP), is thrilled to invite you to an interactive discussion on “Climate: Making a Business Case” with Ms. Alessandra R. Carreon, Commissioner, Michigan Public Service Commission.

Join us for this engaging session as we explore the intersection of business and climate action - RSVP now to confirm your participation!

#ClimateAction #Sustainability #USConsulateChennai #IITMadrasResearchPark #GlobalLeadership
column23: This is awesome Alessandra R. Carreon.  Such a pleasure to meet you last week as part of US delegation to Denmark.  My Alma mater, Indian Institute of Technology, Madras , is doing groundbreaking work in the Energy space - especially relevant in the Indian context.  I’m sure you’ll have a robust discussion.
