When trend-setting organizations like Boston Medical Center (BMC) address issues such as #sustainability #foodinsecurity and #socialjustice and bring them to the forefront by providing practical #solutions… 👏🏽👏🏽

Not all heroes wear capes—during last week's heat wave, customers in our Demand Response program helped drop peak demand on the New England power grid by 375 MW. That's enough electricity to power 200,000+ homes! Explore the benefits of enrolling: http://spr.ly/6040ggMts

I was there Mass Save it was a very sobering event, so many people in the communities committed to making energy efficiency and decarbonization programs just, a shout out to Jhenny Saint-surin Sonakshi Saxena Katherine W. Peters John Massie for working with all of us to make equity a reality.

I had the opportunity to join Gretchen Kershaw, Lawrence Susskind, and Mariama White-Hammond to discuss new approaches to siting energy infrastructure. As we build a clean energy future here in New England, the participation of policy makers, energy stakeholders, utilities and environmental advocates – and discussions such as this panel – are all critical to our shared successes. I’m grateful to the US DOE Deployment Office, Massachusetts Institute of Technology and the City of Boston for their leadership and collaboration. Thank you to Raab Associates, Ltd. for hosting this important conversation. 
#cleanenergy #energyinfrastructure

Loved talking EVs, thermostats, batteries, C&I demand response and thensome at Renew Home’s Residential VPP Summit and CEE’s Summer Program Meeting this week. So many actions we can take now to help make the vision of a sustainable, equitable, optimized grid a reality!
Happy 126th Birthday Environmental League of Massachusetts (ELM)!

I had a chance to listen to Here & Now's Peter O'Dowd speaking with Ali Velshi, chief correspondent for MSNBC, on a concise podcast discussing Ember’s (a London-based think tank) recent report on clean energy. Tune in to https://lnkd.in/dvknQiDw to listen to the entire podcast.

The overall message was meant to be positive, with Velshi noting that in 2023, 30% of the electricity generated came from clean energy sources such as hydro, wind, and solar (such as our recent solar project at Northeastern University’s landmark Snell Library building which welcomes more than two million visitors per year). This is about halfway to the world’s goal of reaching 60% by 2030.

However, a concerning point that emerged from the podcast, which seemed to be overlooked by the commentators, was the 2% increase in global electricity consumption. This is a stark reminder that to limit the rise in the world's average surface temperature to no more than 1.5 degrees C; we must urgently lower energy use, not increase it.

The IPCC (Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change) has identified lowering energy use through efficiency as a crucial pathway to limiting global warming. The International Energy Agency reports that energy efficiency could cut today’s energy bills in advanced countries by one-third and make up 50% of the CO2 reductions needed by 2030 to achieve global climate targets.

Let’s all do our part to leverage advanced technology to drive energy consumption down through efficiency, which will also reduce our energy bills.

Decades from now we’re going to be talking about Framingham, MA being the catalyst for a clean heating and cooling revolution which reduced emissions across the northeast and across the country. To quote Zeyneb Magavi, without whom this project wouldn’t be possible, “this is a pipe dream” that came to life. 

Thanks to the incredible collaboration with the Massachusetts Executive Office of Energy and Environmental Affairs, City of Framingham, Framingham Housing Authority and so many others, we made possible the first utility scale geothermal neighborhood in the United States. What does that mean? We’re now using the earth’s temperature to heat and cool an entire neighborhood which includes a fire station, commercial units, and residences. This is a landmark moment for fighting climate change at the local level. 

I’m immensely proud to have played a small part in the project alongside Nikki Bruno, William Akley, Mary-Jo Boisvert and many more at Eversource Energy. 

The public-private partnership between energy companies is vital for economic development and to supporting our communities in their efforts to reduce their energy use and their carbon footprints. When we work together, this is what’s possible.

I had the opportunity to join Gretchen Kershaw, Lawrence Susskind, and Mariama White-Hammond to discuss new approaches to siting energy infrastructure. As we build a clean energy future here in New England, the participation of policy makers, energy stakeholders, utilities and environmental advocates – and discussions such as this panel – are all critical to our shared successes. I’m grateful to the US DOE Deployment Office, Massachusetts Institute of Technology and the City of Boston for their leadership and collaboration. Thank you to Raab Associates, Ltd. for hosting this important conversation.

column2:
After 3 transformative years at Walmart, it’s time for me to welcome a new and exciting professional challenge (more on this to come!). 

I knew saying goodbye to the most talented, caring, and ambitious people I’ve had the fortune to work with wouldn’t be easy. And it got even harder when, shortly after sharing my news, we learned that the majority of the design org would be impacted by Walmart’s RTO strategy. 

In the face of sudden change, we did what came naturally — we got together over phone, zoom and chats. We spent the last few weeks connecting, strategizing, wondering, reminiscing, laughing, and shedding a few tears. Most of these folks I’ve only met in person once or twice, a fact that has little to do with the quality of our human connection, or the groundbreaking work we deliver.

One common theme out of dozens of conversations was Gratitude. Gratitude for each other, our community, our impact (the agency and influence design has had at the world’s largest retailer is unreal!). It was a special era, and I’m grateful to have been a part of it.

To my Walmart colleagues that are staying, I hope that specialness continues on in a changed but no less meaningful form. You got this. For those that are moving on, I’m rooting for you! My virtual door is always open for you.

There are more people to thank than I’m allowed to tag, so I’ll close with a special shout out to my teams. Together we scaled new heights and had a blast doing it. You are incredible and unstoppable, always!

The legendary, boss designers of Holiday: Alison Yard Medland Alex Saunders Theresa Norton Julissa Higgins Janie Ray Daniel Ramirez (Never met a special mission they couldn’t crush)

The content pioneers & powerhouses: Thy Nguyen Caitlin Browne Natalie M. Dunbar Olivia Koivisto Kevin Young Bill Kurland👨‍🎤 Raider Alvarez Yasmeen Kamel Neil Petty Sarah J. Sharifi Tracy Baxter Colin Mahan Erin Erb & the rest of the crew! (Ampersands intentional 😏 )

Blazing new trails in digital identity and store journeys: Steph Houle Tre Stewart Heemin Jee Demetrios Roumbos André Wyatt Juan Camilo Jaramillo Díaz (The chillest vibes, the embodiment of optimism)

column2:
In my career, I've been blessed with a lovely support network (probably including you, reading this right now!). I have had many absolutely amazing supportive team members and bosses, who have shown me respect and care throughout my career as a researcher. I would not be the colleague I am today without my people.

However, many people who come out as transgender lose their networks in the process of sharing their identity. Those networks are key to everything from finding a job to overall well-being. To celebrate Pride month and give back to my community, I'm participating in a challenge to walk/run 30 miles to help fundraise for the Trans Lifeline. They are there for those folks who lose their networks, providing material support for trans folk who are in crisis.

If you're moved to do so, your donations will go to making sure that trans folks get access to material support when they are in crisis. If you're not able to donate, please consider sharing this fundraiser or starting your own. <3

Happy (almost) Pride Month, friends! 

https://lnkd.in/enhRbevB

column2:
After an incredible 9-year journey with Walmart, it's time for me to bid farewell and embark on a new adventure.
 
I joined Walmart in 2015 and have had the privilege of working in both Walmart Mexico and Central America, and Walmart USA. Throughout these years, I led diverse teams across eCommerce, Digital Factory (Zona 18), and spearheaded Mexico's digital transformation. My journey continued in the USA, where I took on multiple product roles focusing on Product Strategy, Supplier Experience, Item Catalog, Inventory Flow, and Store Innovation and Automation.
 
What other company in the world can provide such a broad range of experiences and opportunities for growth? Walmart has allowed me to develop a comprehensive skill set and gain invaluable insights across different facets of retail and technology. The size of Walmart, breadth and depth of experiences I've had here are unparalleled.
 
Throughout this journey, I've met the most amazing people who have each contributed to my growth as a person and a professional. The long tenures of Walmart employees have always impressed me the most and served as a source of inspiration. Sharing the floor with colleagues who have dedicated 20, 30, or even 40 years to this company has been a profound learning experience.
 
I leave Walmart with a bittersweet feeling. It’s not easy to say goodbye to a company I love, but also excited for the new chapter ahead for my career and my family. There are too many people to thank individually, but I want to give a special shout-out to those who have been particularly impactful in my journey.
 
Thank you, Walmart, for the unforgettable experiences and the lifelong friendships. Onwards and upwards!

I’m excited to announce that I’ve taken on a new role as Chief Sustainability Officer at Petronas Chemical Group in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! Collaborating across the business to shape and execute sustainability strategies aligns perfectly with my expertise and passion for making a meaningful difference. #NewBeginnings #Sustainability #ImpactfulWork #NetZero #Climate

Friends and Colleagues
I am very excited to be able to share that after a tremendous run serving as CEO of Ava Community Energy that I will be joining Octopus Energy Group, where I will work to grow their many clean energy tentacles across North America. 

A few years ago, I started trying to better understand who the best in class, customer obsessed, clean energy companies were so that Ava could shamelessly copy their best ideas. After lots of time spent reading reports, talking to people across the industry and directly engaging the many great and fascinating companies, I came across Octopus Energy. They were doing everything I wanted to do at Ava. 

Building a brand that people really care about - in an industry where people don't know or care about the brand. Octopus has become THE most trusted brand in energy across the UK with Trustpilot scores head and shoulders above the rest of the industry. 

Scaling load flexibility to levels where it actually matters and plays a meaningful role in electricity resource planning - with over 200k EVs and more than a GW of total load under control OE operates the largest VPP in the world. 

Designing technology solutions that fix the underlying 'wiring' issues in utility/CCA operations that make delivering incredible customer service and innovative electrification solutions so difficult - the Kraken suite of products serve over 50m utility meters globally and managing over 30GWs of clean energy.

So when the opportunity presented itself to join the Octopus team and work to bring these capabilities across the pond I was really really intrigued. I also knew that the Ava team was fully ready to take over and continue to overperform. 

Now that my journey at Ava has come to an end, I am ready to take on this amazing, fun and audacious new challenge - to partner with electric utilities across North America to help them drastically scale the delivery clean, affordable and reliable electricity. 

I look forward to catching up with many of you in the very near future. I will continue to be based in San Francisco, CA so if you find yourself in the city by the bay, lets catch up.

My friend and neighbor is going solar. I should be celebrating this, as it puts us one step closer to energy independence and giving climate change a big kick in the pants. Unfortunately, my joy is dampened somewhat by the ever-worsening business practices within our industry.

I don't work in residential solar anymore but I can humblebrag and say I know my way around the industry pretty well after 20+ years in it and even if I had to brush up on the current net metering regs... I've got a good idea how this all works. Having said that, trying to read his "proposal" took me an embarassing little while, largely because so much of it is complete nonsense. I still don't fully understand what my friend has signed up for (and he CERTAINLY doesn't) but here are some things I noticed.
1. The array of financing parties involved is completely absurd. On this one document, I see reference to LGCY Power, Sunrun, and Lux Power. The added bonus is that the project is apparently actually being financed by et another party, who I won't name here. None of those folks are the actual installer, who is yet another party added to the mix. Man, as a consultant, I *am* a soft cost in the solar industry but this seems ridiculous.
2. Their generation estimate is high, which doesn't surprise me (or likely any of you) but it's high by more than I would like to see (>10%) because they didn't look at shading... for a house in the woods. Sigh.
3. When I visited my friend, he had solar on the roof already but, as far as he knew, he had not yet signed a contract. I'm not even sure where to start with that but he believed the contractor had filed for a permit, so I'm still trying to understand just what my friend has done to himself on this one.
4. The system is 10-20% oversized vs. annual load and my friend is not planning any big load increases. I am sure this was done to maximize someone's incentive because it certainly is not optimal for the homeowner. Luckily, for now, Eversource's net metering rate is pretty generous but if that changes a signficant fraction of his generation may be valued below his payment to his financing company. They also are running around with laminated "news articles" about ISO-NE $2.4bn investment in new infrastructure and implying that will all be fully rate based to residential customers.

5. The fear-mongering sales tactics are crazy. They claim utility costs are going up 10% per year (more like 4%-7% in reality, depending on if you look over the past 20 years or past 5 years) and that in 25 years my friend is going to have a $5k+/month electric bill. This makes their 3.5% annual increase seem darn reasonable...

At the end of the day, my friend will save something by going solar... because solar is a fundamentally effective and inexpensive technology. Unfortunately, he will pay (no joke) 4x more for it than he should have and it is down to these predatory sales practices and overly complex financing structures.

On Juneteenth, it’s important to reflect on how far we’ve come as a country — and as an electric utility industry — to achieve diversity, equity and inclusion. It’s also important to recognize that simply commemorating the end of slavery in the United States is not enough. 

I’m here with Southern California Edison (SCE)’s Kristen Yee and Robert Preston Lloyd, participants in Edison Electric Institute’s Diverse and Emerging Leaders program, which provides networking opportunities and exposure to critical issues facing our business. Kristen and Robert are strong leaders who will help power the clean energy future. 

A special thanks to EEI’s Courtney A. Peterson, PCC for championing this program and leading our industry’s DEI efforts and strategies.
 
Edison International, Southern California Edison (SCE) and Trio are committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and belonging, where everyone can bring their whole selves to work.
 
#Juneteenth #freedomday #diversity #equity #inclusion #DEI

Ahead of Father’s Day this weekend, I want to take a moment to give a shoutout to all the fathers and father figures on our CXO team. 

As a father of three boys, I often think back to something my parents used to tell me, when I was their age: “If you want to hoot with the owls, you need to be prepared to scream with the eagles!” In other words, enjoy your late nights, have some fun, but be ready to handle your responsibilities the next morning.

This lesson has stuck with me, and as I watch my boys grow into young men with their own interests and responsibilities, I see its importance even more clearly. It’s a principle that translates directly into our team culture and our success. Managing family responsibilities and professional commitments can be challenging, but it’s that challenge that makes us stronger and more effective. 

Happy Father’s Day to all the dads out there. Your dedication and hard work inspires us all!

Op-Ed: "We pride ourselves in helping New Jersey prepare for a brighter future," writes Rick Thigpen, Senior Vice President - Corporate Citizenship at Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG).

Read more:

As we come together to honor #Juneteenth, I am filled with gratitude for the visible support I am witnessing from my friends and colleagues. This day holds immense historical weight because it marks the emancipation of enslaved Black people in the United States. But it is just as important that the celebration is a testament to the progress occurring as part of the unwavering fight for equality.
 
As the challenging moments grow this year regarding the discussion of equality and rights, we should lean into our shared humanity to keep us unified. We should double our commitment to listening to each other’s lived experiences, while finding opportunities to highlight our similarities, and embrace the benefits of diversity. Our collective strength lies in our ability to uplift one another, regardless of race, gender, culture, or orientation.
 
As a Senior Vice President at Sempra, I stand appreciative and humbly alongside you all. Let us continue this journey toward a better tomorrow, where every individual feels welcomed and thrives. Happy Juneteenth!

Today, I had the privilege of witnessing our dedicated San Diego Gas & Electric teams in action at the annual Local 465 Gas & Electric Rodeo. The commitment to safety, skill, and readiness to respond in emergencies of our line and gas workers is truly inspiring.
 
From the friendly competition to the family activities, it was a day filled with joy and learning. But what stood out the most was the unwavering dedication of our teams. The event is a powerful reminder that when real-life situations arise, our crews are always there, 24/7, day and night, to keep the energy flowing for our customers, even in the face of adversity.
 
I am humbled by their commitment and deeply grateful for their service. Thank you to everyone who joined us today. Watch out International Lineman Rodeo, the SDG&E teams are coming! #BringTheEnergy

International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers (IBEW) 465, Pacific Gas and Electric Company, Southern California Edison (SCE), Imperial Irrigation District, PAR Western Line Contractors, LLC, Sturgeon Electric Company, Inc., Henkels & McCoy West, IBEW Local 1245, Los Angeles Department of Water and Power, Anaheim Utilities, Cal/Nev JATC, Tucson Electric Power, San José Clean Energy

There have been a couple items in my professional world in the last couple months that remind me how much representation matters. The details are irrelevant, but being able to ask questions and challenge biases (my own included) is more valuable than words can describe. 

As we kick off LGBTQ pride month, I’m proud to be in a position to lead, ask questions and challenge the status quo. I’m grateful to work for a company (and with a team) that welcomes those questions and always looks to do better. 

🏳️‍🌈🙌💪

“Nobody makes it to the top alone.” 
— Bill Walton

Words of wisdom from a legend and first speaker in the “Fantastic People Series,” Bill Walton shared his positive energy with colleagues at San Diego Gas & Electric back in 2020.  His impact will be felt for generations to come.

#WaybackWednesday
#TeamworkDreamwork
#EmployeeEngagement

After yet another impactful GridTECH Connect Forum, I want to share my gratitude to our amazing team, advisory board members, speakers, sponsors, and attendees who made this such an impactful event. Here are some parting thoughts after saying goodbye to Newport Beach: 

🤝 There is an undeniable, shared desire among #utilities, #cleanenergy developers, and regulators to collaborate on the critical choke points facing the #energytransition. 

One of my favorite quotes of the week came from Vistra Corp.'s Cathleen Colbert: "I think about this like a ship. You can't just turn a ship on a dime." 

On that front, it was great to see California ISO and California Public Utilities Commission so well-represented across the event. Big thank you to Jill Powers and Gabe Petlin for making this happen.

☀ California is a global leader in fighting #climatechange, but there's much work to be done. One of our keynote speakers, Scale Microgrids co-founder Tim Hade, made the case that "Climate action is war, and California is Normandy." Check out this recap of his remarks here: https://lnkd.in/eYaqyTHf

⏰ We don't have time to continue working in silos. Southern California Edison (SCE) exec Shinjini Menon acknowledged that collaboration is the only way we can achieve our lofty #climate goals: “What got us here will not get us to where we need to go."

column2:
This week WWT had the honor of meeting at NVIDIA headquarters with the NVIDIA leadership team along CEO Jensen Huang. What a fun and productive visit! 

Our discussion covered unique AI developments across manufacturing, financial services, healthcare and life sciences, and delved into NVIDIA's significant contributions to our World Wide Technology Advanced Technology Center AI Proving Ground. This unique lab environment, leading the industry, is where our customers and partners experiment, test, and innovate with the latest AI hardware, software, and reference architectures in a secure, scalable, and transparent manner. Thanks to NVIDIA's groundbreaking hardware and software in the WWT ATC, AI transformation is becoming a reality for our customers. 
 
Our partnership with NVIDIA, marked by a shared focus on AI innovation and business transformation, has grown significantly over the years and continues to shape the future of AI. The advancements we are making for our customers is truly remarkable and we're positioned to create an even greater positive impact in the future. We look forward to continuing this journey of innovation and transformation together! Jensen Huang Jay Puri Craig Weinstein John Rendek Marc Hamilton Jeff Weiss Charles Wuischpard Deepesh Chouhan Manuvir Das Pete Arentson Mat Torgow Matt Horner Leo Makhlin Tim Brooks Brian Ortbals Kent Kellough

column2:
Today Anterix proudly welcomes Oncor as the 7th utility joining us to deploy 900 MHz private broadband networks, now covering 15 states (and growing). Oncor’s decision to deploy a private secure wireless broadband network again highlights the benefits of this technology for utilities, their customers, and the grid, and it also validates our goal of becoming a trusted partner to the entire energy ecosystem. With our current and future utility customers, our Utility Strategic Advisory Board, the incredibly innovative technology leaders in our Anterix Active Ecosystem, and the ongoing collaborative work with the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE)’s National Labs, we collectively are driving an evolution of our Nation’s grid.
We look forward to working with Oncor and with other Texas utilities, including our customers Xcel Energy and LCRA, to support energy resilience, security, and reliability across the entire state of Texas.

POV: You start your day celebrating HEROES with the American Red Cross of Illinois ❤️👮🏼‍♀️

On May 14, more than 800 people came out to the Hilton Chicago to honor local heroes and support the lifesaving mission of the American Red Cross. The 22nd Annual Heroes Breakfast raised $1.639 million from both corporate sponsors and individual donations alike. Along with 2024 Heritage Award recipient Brett Hart (President of United Airlines), the Heroes breakfast honored a class of heroes in categories like:

❤️ Blood Services Hero
❤️ Community Impact Hero
❤️ Disaster Relief Hero
❤️ Education Hero
❤️ Firefighter Hero
❤️ Global Citizenship Hero
❤️ Healthcare Hero
❤️ Law Enforcement Hero
❤️ Lifesaving Rescue Hero
❤️ Military Hero
❤️ Social Justice Impact Hero
❤️ Youth Hero

To read more about the individual honorees and discover how to get involved in your local Red Cross, check out the full Better Magazine article on our website! 

https://lnkd.in/gbd4miMw

#nonprofit #philanthropy #makeitbetter #yousaidit #bettermakers #nonprofitorganization #fundraising #betterhealth #redcross #americanredcross #redcrossillinois
I’m happy to share that I’m starting a new position as Senior Program Manager, Operational Development & Culture at Summit Utilities, Inc.!

Excited to embark on my next chapter with Oncourse Home Solutions as Director of External Affairs and Partnerships! Grateful for the opportunity to lead impactful initiatives and collaborate with diverse stakeholders. Looking forward to contributing to our organization's growth and success.
I’m excited to announce that I’ve embarked on a new journey as a Program Manager / Change Manager in Business Optimization and Technical Services at Southern Company Gas! 🤩

Scrolling for your next opportunity? ➡️ Our social media team at the American Red Cross just opened a NEW position — Social Media Community Manager.

We’re not like a regular team, we’re a fun team that likes to experiment on new platforms, lean in on trends, and thoughtfully engage with our community. 

Some things you should know about this role: 
✨ It is a fully remote position 

✨ Responsibilities include actively engaging with our social media community and monitoring and reporting on conversations using tools like Brandwatch

✨ Assist in sourcing user-generated content and supporting influencer campaigns

✨We’d also LOVE to see Spanish-bilingual applicants. 

Learn more and apply: https://lnkd.in/gjYZhzyS
I’m happy to share that I’m starting a new position as Senior Program Manager, Operational Development & Culture at Summit Utilities, Inc.!

#CompanyPicnic

I had the honor of representing Nicor Gas on the Community Benefits Plan panel at the HISPANICS IN ENERGY and the Illinois Hispanic Chamber of Commerce Midwest Hydrogen Forum and spoke to the great work we do in our communities and how the opportunities from the Midwest Hub can benefit Hispanic and minority businesses! It was also my pleasure to support Meena Beyers at her Executive panel! Thanks to Rachelle Whitacre, Michael Guerra and Gerardo J. Delgado for their support!
What a great morning! We got to talk affordable housing and the benefits of our new interim housing model with our friends at PBS Viewpoint.

👩‍🔧💡 Empowering minds, building futures. Happy International Women in Engineering Day! Here's to the brilliant women who are shaping our world with innovation, determination, and creativity. Your dedication is paving the way and inspiring the next generation of female engineers to dream big and achieve even bigger. Keep breaking barriers and inspiring us all! #WomenInEngineering #STEMinspiration #EngineeringExcellence
Nicor Gas family day with the Chicago Dogs! What a great time! 🌭

Attended the Illinois Manufacturers’ Association (IMA) awards luncheon, where they announced the inaugural class of inductees into the Illinois Manufacturing Hall of Fame.  Did you know that the creation of the cell phone by Motorola was right here in Illinois?

I am thrilled to announce the release of Nicor Gas’ 2023 Community Impact Report! In 2023, $5.4 million was donated to support 344 non-profits across our service territory to support basic needs, protect the environment and enable economic opportunity. During that same time, our dedicated employees have truly gone above and beyond, contributing 2,000 hours of service at 120 events and volunteer projects across Northern and Central Illinois.

Nicor Gas’ commitment to philanthropy and volunteerism is at the heart of everything we do. Yet, it's the strength of our partnerships with organizations like the Northern Illinois Food Bank, United Way of Metro Chicago, The Salvation Army, The Morton Arboretum, Quad County Urban League and many others that amplifies our impact, weaving together a stronger, more extensive network to serve our customers and foster regional growth. 

As I reflect on the achievements highlighted in this report, I’m filled with gratitude for the hard work and generosity of our team. Nicor Gas has been serving Illinois customers for more than 160 years, and we believe that part of our corporate responsibility is to give back. The 2023 Nicor Gas Community Impact Report reflects our commitment to supporting non-profit organizations and enhancing the quality of life for our 2.3 million customers. 

I invite you to dive into our Community Impact Report and join us in celebrating these accomplishments. Together, we can make an even bigger difference. View the full report here: https://lnkd.in/gatmX-mf
Over 200 families received fresh produce, as well as energy efficiency resources at the Nicor Gas produce stand in Bolingbrook.

On #Juneteenth, we commemorate the day in 1865 when the last enslaved people in the United States were emancipated. This is a significant moment in American history, symbolizing freedom and the ongoing pursuit of equality. We take this opportunity to reflect and progress. 

Yesterday, our EnRapport employee resource group hosted a Juneteenth celebration with guest speaker Captain (Ret.) Charles L. Alphin Sr., senior instructor and curriculum consultant of The Martin Luther King, Jr. Center for Nonviolent Social Change (The King Center). He reflected on Dr. King’s nonviolence philosophy, using our minds to change hearts, and ways we all can commit to fostering a future where equality is at the forefront of our values. #FuelingEquity

I am thrilled to announce that Nicor Gas has been honored with the prestigious Habitat for Humanity Hero Award! This recognition is a testament to our unwavering commitment to community service and our dedication to creating a positive and sustainable impact in the communities we serve.
 
We’re longtime partners of Habitat for Humanity both in volunteer efforts and home builds, but also in building the state’s first Smart Neighborhood – a collection of 30 net-zero homes in Aurora and Carpentersville. The homes will feature smart building exteriors, energy efficient heating and cooling and back up energy solutions. 
 
I want to extend a heartfelt thanks to Habitat for Humanity for this incredible honor and for the opportunity to be part of their admirable mission. I also want to acknowledge the hard work and passion of our employees, whose dedication makes achievements like this possible.
 
This award motivates us to continue our efforts in supporting our communities and to keep making a positive impact wherever we can. Here's to building stronger, more sustainable communities together!

Felt good to be a small piece in what will be such big change in someone’s life. 
Thank you Habitat for Humanity for all you do for so many. Thank you Women's Energy Network Chicago for giving me this opportunity to give back and pick up some new knowledge while doing it.

I am thrilled to announce the success of AABE Chicago Chapter Scholarship Golf Outing last Saturday! Thanks to our members and volunteers! A huge thank you to everyone who answered our call to action and participated in this fantastic fundraising event. Your support has been invaluable in helping us achieve our mission.

Thanks to your generous contributions, we have provided 10 scholarships totaling $18,000 to talented minority students pursuing energy-related careers. Shoutout to all our incredible sponsors! Your partnership and support have been instrumental in raising over $48,000, which will help break down barriers for these deserving students and open doors to promising STEM careers.

Together, we are making a difference in the lives of our future energy leaders. Thank you for your unwavering support and commitment to the American Association of Blacks in Energy/AABE Chicago Chapter!

#AABEChicago #ScholarshipGolfOuting #SupportSTEM #FutureEnergyLeaders #DiversityInEnergy

Today marks my third year with the American Red Cross. I have never felt closer to our lifesaving mission. I’m thankful to work alongside an incredible team of staff and volunteers. My colleagues inspire and remind me every day why we do this critical work. I’m in awe of our donors who fuel the work of our mission for those who need us most!

We had a great time with Nicor Gas representatives at Naperville Youth Club golf fundraiser. It was great hearing from the students participating in this year’s Coding Summer Camp as they learn different languages like C++, C#, JavaScript and Python. These students are being setup for tremendous success because of the work of those at the Naperville Youth Club.
I’m happy to share that I’ve obtained a new certification: Successful Speaking from The Institute for Management Studies!

The AABE Chicago Metropolitan Chapter Scholarship Golf Outing was a phenomenal event shared with Nicor Gas colleagues and various professionals across the energy sector!! The Chapter awarded $18,000 in scholarships to 10 deserving students across the Chicagoland region. Truly honored to be a member of the AABE Scholarship Committee where making generational difference is realized for so many!!!

Happy belated International Women in Engineering Day (June 23rd)!  We celebrated the incredible contributions of women in engineering with a coffee truck/donuts for the office and a Ladies Luncheon for our female engineers. It was a wonderful opportunity to network, share experiences and inspire each other. Thank you to those who helped make this happen. Here's to empowering women in engineering and beyond! 💪🔧🌎

 U.S. Women in Nuclear (U.S. WIN) and Westinghouse Electric Company

Bringing two new advanced Westinghouse AP1000® reactors online in Georgia in the last 12 months capped years of hard work by thousands of world-class professionals. Plant Vogtle Units 3 and 4 are the first new reactors in the United States in 30 years.

Hear from some of our employees as they reflect on the incredible effort in collaboration with Georgia Power, Southern Nuclear, Bechtel and many other partners and suppliers.

ALWAYS ON: U.S. nuclear power plants operate at FULL power more than 93% of the time and have held capacity factors north of 90% since the early 2000s.

Learn more: https://bit.ly/2lI2LYg

Chelsea Smith and I have been kicking off our summer at the Westinghouse Electric Company zirconium production facility in beautiful Ogden, Utah!

All this week we've been on site learning about the processes associated with producing zirconium metal, and working with the site team to help protect our people and our plant so they can continue to supply this critical element of the nuclear supply chain. 

Many thanks to Mark Bowman, Alan Moreno, Mike Courouleau MS CIH CSP SGE, Tim Burton, and the many others who contributed to a successful week of collaboration and team building.

OCNI is proud to support our members like Westinghouse as they continue to innovate and grow, strengthening Canada's role in the global nuclear industry. Here’s to more success and innovation in the future!

Today, President Biden welcomes President Ruto of Kenya for a State Visit and Dinner to celebrate and deepen ties between our two nations, marking years of official U.S.-Kenya partnership.  The two leaders’ agenda includes enhancing our partnership on clean energy and resilience, which includes deepening U.S.-Africa Nuclear Industry Cooperation. 

To further this goal, and as announced in the FACTSHEET, one of the deliverables is that the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) in partnership with Kenya and Ghana, plans to host the second installment of the U.S.-Africa Nuclear Energy Summit (USANES) on Industry Readiness in Nairobi, Kenya, in August 2024. Recognizing the historic relationship between the United States and Kenya, USANES 2024 envisions U.S. and African policymakers, technical experts, and industry leaders convening in Nairobi to address critical issues impacting industry readiness and the future of nuclear energy on the African continent.  The Summit comprises educational workshops, stakeholder engagement sessions, and multilateral discussions on topics from financing and workforce development to supply chain preparedness.

(more info: Office of Nuclear Energy, U.S. Department of Energy, Aleshia Duncan, Anushya Ramaswamy)

column2:
I'm shutting down my startup, RAVACAN.

5 years after I founded it.

Here are 5 lessons and reflections:

↓

1. We don't have product-market fit

- Building an enterprise-grade software is incredibly costly
- No buying intent from Direct procurement
- Procurement managers lack the authority to drive changes internally

2. Creating a new category is hard

- Manufacturing companies prefer highly customizable solutions over SAAS
- Educating the market about a new category requires significant time and resources
- Buyers can't compare and feel the risk is higher

3. Why I'm Stopping This

- We had minimal returns despite significant effort
- We cannot build what the market needs with minimal capital, and open-source solutions exist (more on this soon!)
- Manufacturers are secretive and don't share the word with their peers even when they are very happy

4. Things I Would Have Done Differently

- Targeted more dynamic niches like semiconductors or raw materials
- Engage smaller companies instead of enterprises
- Offer the product for free to get references

5. My Most Critical Learnings

- Don't build something people need, but something they want
- Better be the second best than the first (Edit: Better be challenger than pioneer)
- Use funding momentum and don't let it go away

Richard Branson said, "The brave may not live forever, but the cautious do not live at all." I try to live by this every day.

On one hand, it's tough to shut down something I've poured my heart into. 
On the other hand, I feel a sense of relief and gratitude. The journey with RAVACAN has been an incredible learning experience. The lessons I've gained, the skills I've developed, and the insights I've gathered are invaluable.

While RAVACAN's chapter is closing, these experiences will undoubtedly shape my future endeavors. I’m eager to apply what I’ve learned to whatever comes next.

Thank you to my talented and tenacious teammates Benjamin BEGUIN, Carles Ballester, to our first clients who saw the future with us, especially Mike Maloney, to our investors who supported me every step of the way Vincent Diallo, Laura Brady, Benjamin Ling, Collin Gutman, Jeff Weinstein. My mentor Gary Geschwind.
column23: Sounds like you achieved some amazing returns from this investment, albeit in the form of experience and wisdom rather than shareholder value. Sorry this one didn't work out.  I applaud your grit and the honesty of your reflections.

column2:
The End of an Era

This week marks a significant turning point as I've made the decision to leave Coupa Software. This decision is wrapped in immense pride and gratitude to my colleagues (and former colleagues!), customers, partners, industry analysts, and board members from all stages. 

Walking through the Coupa doors 13 years ago, I could never have imagined the phenomenal story we'd create. We started as a fledgling company with a bold vision: to become a Salesforce -like platform for Business Spend Management. We had big dreams and even bigger determination, evident by the post-it notes that adorned our (budget-less) walls!

What followed was phenomenal growth. We grew Coupa from $1 million in recurring revenue into a $1 billion powerhouse. We built a differentiated platform, powered by an innovative community AI model. We cultivated a vibrant customer community with our spirit of “ensure customer success” driving our decisions. 

We earned over 100 software patents (24 with my name), secured leadership positions in 150+ analyst reports, and went toe-to-toe with SAP! Along the way, we had an incredible IPO, a meteoric public market rise, and ultimately, a successful Thoma Bravo privatization valued at a staggering $8 billion.

The memories I'll cherish most are the incredible IPO experience, the epic hackathons (even if held in a tiny bank vault!), fun customer advisory boards that embodied the spirit of "none of us is as smart as all of us," the thrilling Great Race-style global sales cycles, and of course, the goofy product videos that hopefully made people outside Coupa laugh as much as they made us laugh in Coupa! 

To the wonderful colleagues (past and present), customers, partners, analysts, and board members that spent so much time collaborating with me personally on this journey, thank you from the bottom of my heart. It’s been an absolute honor working alongside such brilliant, hardworking, and dedicated people. I could never have played my role in Coupa’s success without you. I hope our roads cross in the future. 

While my journey at Coupa comes to a close, a new and exciting chapter for me awaits. I'm excited for the next challenge and can't wait to share the details with you all next week! In typical Donna fashion, I start on Monday. 😀 

In the meantime, tell me about your favorite Coupa memories below. Let's celebrate the incredible journey we've been on!

 #BSM #Procurement #S2P #CIO #CPO #SpendManagement #AI Rob Bernshteyn Ravi Thakur Raja Hammoud JP Krishnamoorthy David Williams Tony Tiscornia Todd Ford Roger Kaufmann Rob Glenn Steve Winter Fang Chang Arjun Ramaratnam Tara Ryan Tony Wessels Roger Goulart Jon Stueve Mathias Radtke Chandar Pattabhiram Michael Schanker Ray Martinelli Mark Riggs Gabe Perez Leagh Turner Kevin Iaquinto Kevin Burns Sameer Areff Stephen Knipe Craig Newfield Susan Toyama Kevin Iaquinto Neeraj Agrawal Michael V. Ronan Kerouedan Alex Kleiner III Rebecca Morris Dr. Elouise Epstein 🏳️‍⚧️
column23: Wow, Donna. What a ride !!One of the many learnings I took from my time at Coupa which I've taken forward into my new career... "to be a great SaaS company, you need a Donna"... somebody who lives and breathes the strategy; who energizes those around them to be the best they can be; somebody who touches everything that is success and fixes everything that is not success. Your impact was huge. On Coupa, and on allofus! Congratulations!

🚨 Shhh... Don't tell Jason! 🚨
 
It's our CEO Jason Kurtz's birthday today, and we're planning a surprise celebration! 🥳
 
You know how he's always reminding us to "make it happen"? Well, we're taking that advice to heart.
 
Let's play a game.

This August, I’ll begin my journey towards earning a PhD at Claremont Graduate University, and I could not be more excited!

Someone at work once criticized me I for taking on too much at once. And that stuck with me for a while. So against all my natural tendencies, I deliberately narrowed my professional focus. Not only was it hard, but I was actually LESS productive. You see, ideation is what runs through my veins- it’s what powers me. Removing my source of inspiration is like taking the engine out of a car and expecting it to run. What I’ve come to realize is that “too much” is when I am at my best. And incidentally, it’s when I’m at my happiest too. 

I look forward to diving deep into research, with the goal of advancing the profession of Resource Management, collaborating with fellow scholars and professionals, and firing on ALL cylinders. 😉 

I’ll be forever grateful for the encouragement from Paul Robinson, my family, friends, and mentors who have supported me in this new pursuit.

Thank you for being part of my journey. Here’s to new challenges, growth, and discoveries! Stay tuned for updates on my research and adventures in academia. ✨🎓

#PhDJourney #CGUBound #HigherEducation #ResourceManagement
#FiringOnAllCylinders

With immeasurable gratitude, I share the bittersweet news that Friday was my last day at EcoVadis. It has been a pleasure and an honor to watch the company grow into the indisputable leader in #SustainableProcurement, a market category that just barely existed when I joined nearly seven years ago. 
 
There have been so many remarkable milestones along the way. Working to make Business Sustainability Ratings a mainstream concept. Figuring out how we should pronounce our name (ee-koh-vah-dis)! Driving partnerships and integrations with all the Source to Pay and TPRM colleagues. Developing the eLearning Academy so suppliers could embrace improvement. All seven amazing SUSTAIN events, especially pivoting to an online conference just 10 days after the world locked down in 2020. Supporting two major funding rounds. Establishing critical NPS processes and insights to inform our direction. Creating so much compelling thought leadership that the share of voice is nearly unbelievable. Officially becoming a purpose-led business to “Guide all companies to a sustainable world.” Helping grow the EcoVadis solution portfolio and network to over 2.4M screened suppliers and 140K+ rated suppliers – and revelling as more companies than ever discover Sustain +Ability, getting a rating WITHOUT BEING ASKED – because it’s good business. Partnering closely with sales to achieve 10x+ ARR from 2017 to now. Navigating more acronyms and regulations than I may care to remember 😊. 

And most proudly - building from a team of 5 marketers to over 50, including dozens of nationalities, locations and functions – and somehow still creating a tight-knit group that cares deeply for each other while executing like crazy. Working with you all has been an absolute joy. 
 
My sincerest thanks to our co-CEOs, Pierre-Francois Thaler and Frederic Trinel, for this incredible opportunity to cut my teeth as a #CMO - I have learned and grown so much. To my EcoVadis leadership colleagues and all EcoVadians with whom I’ve dived deep day in and day out, thank you for your collaboration, persistence, passion and optimism – you are changing the world one company at a time. And to my dear EV marketers – thank you for everything - keep innovating and reaching for the stars. I will miss you most. Cécile Dorvault David McClintock Meena Hans Robert Altman Angie Marcel Daniel Perry

I will keep EcoVadis in my heart and cheerlead your purpose and success always!
 
What’s next? I’ll be starting on an exciting new journey later in July. Stay tuned for the news but – spoiler alert – I’m still a procurement software geek 😊!

#grateful #LifeAtEcoVadis #newbeginnings

This year, we celebrate a monumental milestone—Bel Fuse Inc.'s 75th anniversary! Founded by my grandfather and now led by my father, Dan Bernstein as CEO, Bel Fuse stands as a testament to enduring success and unwavering commitment to core values.

Growing up, I had the privilege of witnessing firsthand the dedication, resilience, and integrity that fueled the family business. Here are some fundamental principles that have been passed down through generations, shaping not only Bel's journey but also my approach as an Operating Partner in the private equity space:

- Respecting the Team: Bel has always believed in treating employees like family. This deep respect for the team has fostered a culture of loyalty, collaboration, and mutual growth. It's a principle I hold dear, knowing that a company's true strength lies in its people. 

- Running the Business the Right Way: Integrity has always been at the heart of Bel Fuse. My grandfather's mantra of doing business the right way—fairly, ethically, and transparently—has been a cornerstone of success. This ethos guides my interactions and decisions as I work with founders to build sustainable and ethical businesses.

- Balancing Conservatism with Aggression: One of the most valuable lessons I've learned is the art of balancing conservative strategies with calculated risks. My father has and continues to excel at identifying moments to be bold while maintaining a prudent approach. This balance is crucial in driving growth without compromising stability.

- Consistent Leadership and Values: The importance of consistent leadership and adherence to core values cannot be overstated. At Bel Fuse, leadership is not just about steering the company but embodying the values that have been their foundation. I strive to bring this consistency to portcos I partner with, ensuring that the companies I support stay true to their roots while evolving for future success.

As I reflect on these invaluable lessons, I am filled with pride and gratitude. They have not only shaped Bel Fuse's legacy but also equipped me to support other founders on their journeys. In my current role, I leverage these insights to help entrepreneurs navigate challenges, seize opportunities, and build businesses that stand the test of time.

Here's to 75 years of Bel Fuse—and to many more years of leadership, integrity, and success!

#BelHistory #Leadership #FamilyBusiness #Values #PrivateEquity #Legacy #BusinessGrowth #EmployeeFirst #CustomerFocus #Innovation

What makes summer camp special? It's the relationships, the experiences, and the memories that occur over a short period of time but stick with you much longer. Last week, we looked to capture that same vibe (with way nicer accommodations) at Nexa Equity's Summer Operator Offsite.

Thank you to Traci Burgess and Drew Bernstein for putting together some awesome sessions, to Vendara (Formerly Choice Merchant Solutions), Autura, Leap , HomeTown Ticketing, Inc, Storewise, and Easy Metrics Inc. for being incredible to work with, Wildflower Farms, Auberge Resorts Collection for hosting us, & Vlad Besprozvany for making this all possible!
Many people are managing things that don't matter...  How to avoid this:

2022 LinkedIn Selling Strategies don't work anymore...

We've all been there – you accept a LinkedIn connection request, and BAM! Immediate sales pitch. This needs to end. Imagine meeting someone on the street, them saying "nice to meet you," and then instantly asking you for money or some crazy trade. You would think they are nuts.

Here's a better approach (and there are about 1000 better than the one above): leverage the accepted connection to gain insights and develop a genuine relationship. Learn what's important to them. Comment on their posts, share insights they may find valuable, and build trust and credibility through those actions.

When the time is right, send a message that aligns with what you've learned. Provide a thoughtful, Doug Landis-patented hypothesis that demonstrates you understand their business (and needs). No sales pitch is necessary in that message either!

Don't want to be treated like a spam account? Then stop acting like one.

And if you put the sales pitch in the connection request, that's an automatic decline for me.

I am excited to share with all our entrepreneurs, partners and friends that today Telstra Ventures starts a new chapter in our journey, changing our name to Titanium Ventures 🚨
 
We chose Titanium Ventures because it best represents who we are, who we want to be and the founders we back - strong, resilient people, who resist cracking under pressure, building enduring companies. 
 
Titanium has the highest durability and strength-to-weight ratio of any metal in the world and like the leaders we invest in, we punch way above our weight.
 
Our investment thesis remains the same and we will continue to identify and scale the most promising companies across a variety of AI, digital and software sectors.
 
So far we’ve invested in 99 portfolio companies, resulting in:
 
🚀 12 IPOs
🚀 17 unicorns
🚀 42 liquidity events 
 
Today we have almost US$1B funds under management and have returned US$678M cash to investors. 
 
This is an exciting next chapter in our story. Titanium Ventures will continue to accelerate the extraordinary, fueling the growth of standout disruptors, that’s what we have done for over a decade and that’s what our investors and founders expect us to do in the decades to come.

Managing more than 60 hotels from upstate New York all the way down to Georgia, Visions Hotels has established a benchmark for exemplary guest experience on the East Coast.

In 2019, Visions partnered with Otelier (formerly MDO) to deploy a business intelligence solution that would automate back-office reporting and centralize performance data from across its portfolio, allowing leadership unique insight to build data-driven strategies. Today, general managers, accounting teams, and corporate leaders spend less time on manual data entry and back-office tasks, freeing them up to focus on driving guest satisfaction.

"The spike in inflation over the past couple years means profitability doesn’t flow the same way it once did. So, it’s important for our team members at the property level and corporate to always be hyper aware of our daily performance,” says Jason D'Agostino, Corporate Director of Revenue Management at Visions Hotels. "IntelliSight has been crucial for our team members who rely on automated dashboards each morning, showing rooms sold, GSS scores, rate-shopping data, our STAR reports, all in one spot."

#CustomerSpotlight #VisionsHotels #Hospitality #HotelTech

I’m excited to share that today I am transitioning to the role of senior advisor to the retirement business at BlackRock. It is a time for reflection as well as a step toward the future.

My journey with BlackRock actually started well before I joined the firm. As BlackRock’s investment banker at Merrill Lynch, I helped BlackRock launch some of its early closed end funds. When I decided to join BlackRock officially in 2000 as the head of the retail team, I could only imagine what an amazing and fulfilling career journey I would have - helping to build one of the best investment management firms in the world. 
 
For the last nine years, I have had the privilege of leading BlackRock’s US retirement business. I am so grateful to our clients, who helped me understand what it means for their employees to retire with dignity. I have been humbled by the work of so many in the industry to make the retirement system work for everyone. I have been inspired by my colleagues’ passion to make secure retirements within the reach of every worker. 
 
Now, it’s my turn. And, if I’m honest, it’s a little weird. I don’t have plans to slow down any time soon. Frankly, the word “retirement” just doesn’t fit how I feel. I see it more as my “next chapter” – and I really like the Spanish word for it: jubilacion. Because that is how I feel. Joyful. I feel full of energy that I get to continue to work on the issues that matter to me most. I also feel incredibly grateful to everyone who has helped me and inspired me on my journey. I’m excited to see what this next stage brings.
Excited to be starting an adventure in my hometown with wonderful new colleagues!

Do you also suffer from ONE thing that can hinder your career progression and may make your day to day work a struggle?



These statements were taken randomly from some of my clients’ worksheets, do you recognise yourself in any of them?


🥺 Usually, I doubt myself and find out later that I was right at first.


😟 I do care very heavily about what people think about me.


🤨 I want people to know that “he’s good” at what he does. I want that reputation.


😒 I worry about the perception from colleagues


😰 My procrastination on the task that scares me the most: prepping well for the evaluation session. I am to some extent afraid of being successful, so I don’t even try.



So, what is that ONE thing?



These days it is conveniently referred to as “the impostor syndrome” however, it is a combination of several intertwined thought patterns and behaviours that may be difficult to dissect and understand. They could include:

-Depending excessively on external validation

-Self doubt

-Lack of confidence

-Feeling not good enough (or a fraud)

-Fear of failure

-Fear of success

And more…

If you have experienced similar thoughts, moods, emotions that have impacted your performance, your clarity and drive and as a result you are “selling yourself short” or are not being as bold as you’d like, know that:

✳️ Even the most successful, powerful people have these experiences

✳️ Consistent work on yourself will pay off – understanding your limiting beliefs is a first step!

✳️ You can “feel the fear and do it anyway!” but that’s so much easier if someone has your back

✳️ What other people think of you – is none of your business!

✳️ What you think of yourself is entirely your business!

✳️ Focus on YOU and not on others. Do what you can, with what you’ve got – NOW

✳️ Love your life and your life will love you back!

And if this is not enough, do talk to me – I’m very high on compassion (according to Jordan Peterson - more than 93 people in a room of 100) and I can also teach you some saboteur-slaying techniques! 🤣 😜

#careersuccess #impostorsyndrome #careercoaching

Dear Friends and Colleagues,

I would like to share with you that on May 20, 2024, our beloved dad, Shan K. Thever, passed away.

Our dad was a vibrant personality, energetic professional and dedicated husband, father and grandfather. He was an inspiration in so many ways and to so many people. 

He came to this country with only a few hundred dollars in his pocket. Through his determination, hard work and tenacity, he successfully completed his undergraduate education at UCLA and received his JD from UCLA School of Law. 

Our dad went on to establish and lead a successful law practice for decades. He was a trailblazer and a pioneer both in and out of the courtroom. He was courageous, took risks and overcame numerous obstacles, and was a preeminent attorney, successfully arguing cases in front of the California Supreme Court. He served as the Director of the Small Law Firm Center at the New York City Bar Association and for the past five years he served as the Deputy County Council for Los Angeles County as a member of the Ethics, Transparency and Legislative Affairs team.

Our dad was a colleague, friend and confidant of Governors, County Supervisors, Council Members and so many others. In addition to numerous awards and appointments, he received the inaugural Trailblazer Award from the South Asian Bar Association and was recognized by the U.S. House of Representatives, receiving a U.S. Congressional Commendation for being an inspiring leader in the South Asian community and a true advocate for political change among the Asian population.

He was an inspiration not only for the professional success he achieved, but also for the way he lived his life. He believed in living a productive and meaningful life, in helping others, in lifting his community and in creating greater opportunity for his children than he had himself. He instilled in us a deep responsibility to, in turn, create greater opportunity for our children and generations to come. He also instilled in us the importance of public service and of being contributing members of society and having a meaningful impact on the world.

In his personal time he loved to be with his family celebrating holidays, cooking together, and discussing politics and current events over a bottle of Cabernet. 

He loved his grandchildren more than anything and was so very proud to see the young people they are and the success they continue to achieve. He was happy to see the wealth of opportunity in front of them. 

While he may not be here in physical form, our dad is always with us. He lived a successful, productive and impactful life, and this world is a better place because of him.

We ask that if you have any special anecdotes, stories or memories about our dad to please share with us via private message.

😲 $100M as an NBA player...why not!? Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks might out-earn Jordan and LeBron combined! 

....Meanwhile, Caitlin Clark who has dominated the news is earning $76,500 in her rookie year. 😡 ....

What should you know?

💸 CNBC reported that 60% of NBA players go broke within 5 years of departing the league

💸 The average male retirement age is between 28-34 
💸 The average WNBA player lasts about 5 years in the league, also retiring in their early 30s

Ouch.

🏀 Being an all star athlete requires outrageous physical, spiritual, and mental hard work and discipline. Then you arrive... and?

The discipline related to money is different. Preservation requires an emotional anchor to the future. ⚓ 

Athletes, particularly, struggle to find opportunities to make the same kind of money later in life. They live a dream for a few years and at retirement, they wake up. 😕 

☁ Get out of the present by imagining the future. 
- Who is there?
- Where are you?
- What are you doing?
- Where are you living?
- What activities are you enjoying?
- How often do you travel? to where?
- What car are you driving?
- What are your ongoing sources of income?
- Are you working?
- Have you invested in assets that accumulate value over time?
- Are you aligning your money with your values? How?
- What makes you feel alive?
- What is keeping you active, fulfilled, finding purpose and meaning?
- Who do you share your money with? How?

Think about this NOW dear Luka. The odds are not in your favor.

If you need some help working through your relationship with the future. Give us a try at knomee.com! We're here to help!

I’m retiring and downsizing to an RV called Priscilla. It's a bit scary. A lot of your self-worth gets locked up in the job over time. I get bored easily. And is there enough $$? But mostly, I’m VERY excited. Gotta take some risk to live! We’re planning to take Priscilla on two big loops. This year up to Newfoundland and down to the Yucatan; next year up to Alaska and back down to Mexico’s Pacific coast. Then we’ll sell her, move to France and explore from there. I'm glad we're RVing now that we're still relatively young. Priscilla may look pretty sleek, but she’s really a wooden box on wheels stuffed with electronics. There’s lots to know if you don’t want to blow up the poop tank! And you need to do lots of planning ... or find yourself packed like sardines at a campsite just off the highway. Let’s see how it goes. If it’s a bust, my next post will be something like: "Help! Anybody need a non-AI writer/editor or (if I’m really desperate) an operations guy?"

Big day...Bigger tomorrow. CrowdStrike joins the S&P500. Fastest cybersecurity company to do so. Amazing to see CrowdStrike's generational impact on #cybersecurity: 1️⃣ Bringing cybersecurity to the cloud; 2️⃣ Bringing #AI to cybersecurity; 3️⃣ Creating cybersecurity's first and only platform to stop breaches. Humbled by market leaders sharing this moment with us:

https://lnkd.in/gePNEwRP

▶ Marc Benioff, Chair and CEO, Salesforce: “Just as Salesforce created the SaaS model that revolutionized business operations, CrowdStrike has transformed how cybersecurity is delivered and experienced. CrowdStrike is a critical cybersecurity partner, allowing us to consolidate multiple products on the Falcon platform. CRM is Salesforce. Cybersecurity is CrowdStrike.” 

▶ Matt Garman, CEO, Amazon Web Services (AWS): “CrowdStrike’s inclusion in the S&P 500 is a well-deserved milestone that underscores their pioneering work in cybersecurity. CrowdStrike is a trusted AWS customer and partner, and we have a long history of working together to secure sensitive data and workloads for the world’s most innovative and highly regulated organizations, from startups to enterprises to governments. Congratulations to the CrowdStrike team on this significant achievement.”

▶ Toto Wolff, Team Principal & CEO, Mercedes-AMG PETRONAS Formula One Team: “In car production and motorsport, speed, quality and consistency are key to success. Working closely with George Kurtz and the CrowdStrike team, I couldn’t be prouder of the cybersecurity outcomes they deliver. Stopping breaches requires extreme speed, and that’s exactly what the AI-native Falcon platform delivers. Congratulations to CrowdStrike on reaching the exclusive S&P 500 list.”

Such an honor to host Ali Krieger at our offices last week in celebration of Pride at Blackstone. OUT Blackstone and our Women’s Initiative sponsored a fireside chat with Ali, an accomplished athlete who shared her insights on leadership and teamwork and spoke powerfully about being true to oneself in all aspects of life. Music from the Queer Big Apple Corps band set a celebratory mood as more than a hundred employees gathered to show #Pride.

I was honored to receive the Lincoln Medal from Ford's Theatre Society. And it was particularly special having a “real” medalist – Olympic gold winner Valarie Allman – present the award. She’s a multi-time recipient of grants I support through the USA Track & Field Foundation for our promising athletes. My favorite advice from Lincoln which I shared that evening: “I do the best I know how, the very best I can; and mean to keep doing so until the end.” That’s what I try to do — in business, in philanthropy, and with the opportunities I've had to lend help to leaders in Washington from both parties.
